text: If [Young Rumormonger](young-rumormonger) redirects the dishonor, the cost is still considered to be paid, and the character that was originally selected for dishonor gets the attachment.

If Calling in Favors is used to dishonor a character and take control of an opponent's attachment that is attached to that same character (e.g. [Cloud the Mind](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/cloud-the-mind), [Fiery Madness](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/fiery-madness)), the attachment stays in play.

If an opponent's event instructs a player to \*choose\* a target, the character with Above Question cannot be chosen. This also applies to events that instruct another player to choose targets (e.g. [Court Games](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/court-games)).

Above Question does not prevent attached character from being sacrificed for [Way of the Crab](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/way-of-the-crab) (that event doesn't instruct a player to \*choose\* a character, so it's non-targeting).
If a participating character is bowed, it is still considered participating.

Agasha Swordsmith can only find a card with the printed attachment cardtype. Monk characters that can be played as attachments ([Tattooed Wanderer](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/tattooed-wanderer), [Togashi Kazue](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/togashi-kazue)) are not attachments while they're out of play.
Aggressive Moto cannot be declared as a defender, but can be moved to a conflict on the defending side by card effects.
The Pride keyword resolves immediately when the conflict winner is determined, before any Reactions to winning/losing a conflict can be used.
When playing Ambush, you need to reveal the characters that you're going to put into play before your opponent gets the opportunity to cancel the event's effects.
A card can have multiple instances of the same keyword, but functions as if it has one instance of that keyword.
A card can have multiple instances of the same keyword, but functions as if it has one instance of that keyword.
Losing 3 honor is the cost of Assassination. By the time the ability's effects can be cancelled, costs have already been paid, and honor has already been lost.

When Banzai! is played, a player can choose to cancel Banzai!’s entire card effect, just the second part of its effect, or none of its effect.

- When Banzai!’s effect initiates during the step 6 of playing the card (see [Playing Cards](https://fiveringsdb.com/rules/reference#initiating-abilities-playing-cards)), the effects that initiate are: “you may lose 1 honor, the chosen character gets +2, and if you lost 1 honor resolve this ability twice.” If Banzai!’s effects are canceled at this time, none of those things happen and the card’s effects do not resolve at all.

- If those effects resolve, and the 1 honor is lost, “resolve this ability twice” causes the ability’s resolution to return to step 5 (“choose a participating character”). This causes the effects to initiate a second time, and thus they can be canceled a second time to prevent the second +2 and optional honor loss.
Effects that modify the value of the honor bid only affect the current bid, the setting on the dial is not physically adjusted.

"Discard if political skill is 0" is a part of the lasting effect that applies until the end of the conflict. If Shoju's ability doesn't lower the character down to 0 skill immediately, but a subsequent effect during the same conflict does, the character will be discarded.

If a replacement effect is used to prevent the character from leaving play (e.g. [Reprieve](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/reprieve), [Stand Your Ground](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/stand-your-ground)) but does not concurrently increase its political skill above 0, Shoju's effect will immediately reapply, and the character will be discarded again.

If Bayushi Shoju leaves the conflict after using his ability, the lasting effect will persist regardless.
Bayushi Yunako cannot switch base skills on a character that has a dash (–) for a skill (dash values cannot be modified or changed).
If Bayushi Yunako leaves the conflict after using her ability, the lasting effect will persist regardless.
When you take control of a character, you do not take control of any attachments attached to that character.
If you take control of a character that has an attachment that says "*Attach only to characters you control*", that attachment is immediately discarded.
If you take control of a non-participating character, it goes to your home, it does not enter the conflict.
Borderlands Defender cannot be chosen to bow for [For Shame!](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/for-shame) or [Doji Gift Giver](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/doji-gift-giver).
During a conflict, the contested ring does not count as unclaimed.

Breakthrough is played after participants of the first conflict go home bowed, and a new conflict starts immediately. There is no action window between conflicts in which you could ready a character in time for it to be declared as an attacker (e.g. [Border Rider](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/border-rider), [I Am Ready](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/i-am-ready)).
Changing the conflict type does not affect what other conflicts the attacker can declare. What matters is which conflict type was originally declared.

When the conflict type is switched, any characters that cannot participate in the conflict of the new type (have a dash (–) for a skill, or have [Pacifism](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/pacifism) attached) immediately go home bowed.
You cannot place additional fate on characters when you **put** them **into play** by card effects. You can only do that when you **play** characters from provinces or from hand.

You cannot put a character into play participating in a conflict if that character cannot participate in that conflict (has a dash (–) for a skill, or a relevant constant ability, e.g. [Shiba Peacemaker](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/shiba-peacemaker), [Pacifism](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/pacifism)).
Effects that modify the value of the honor bid only affect the current bid, the setting on the dial is not physically adjusted.

If you select the option to make your opponent dishonor a character, the target is chosen during the resolution of the ability's effects. At that point it is too late to cancel the initiation of effects (e.g. via [Shiba Yōjimbō](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/shiba-yojimbo)).

*Note that this is a non-standard template, usually you choose targets before the opportunity to cancel the initiation of effects (the word "choose" is usually printed before the dash (–) in the ability's text).*

Dishonoring a character is an effect of Court Mask's ability, not a cost. So you can return it to your hand even if attached character cannot be dishonored (already dishonored, or [Steward of Law](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/steward-of-law) is participating in the conflict).

Daimyō's Favor can reduce the cost of characters played as attachments (eg. [Tattooed Wanderer](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/tattooed-wanderer), [Togashi Kazue](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/togashi-kazue)).
The bonus provided by Disdainful Remark is fixed upon resolution. If the number of cards in the opponent's hand subsequently changes, the bonus is not affected.
Only printed text is blanked. Text gained from another source is not blanked.

When Display of Power is played, it produces a delayed effect that cancels the normal effects of ring resolution during step 3.2.6 “Resolve Ring Effects” and replaces it with “resolve the ring effect as if you had won the conflict as the attacking player.” Losing honor for unopposed and breaking the province will occur before resolving Display of Power’s effect.

- Should [Pilgrimage](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/pilgrimage) not be broken when Display of Power resolves, the delayed effect of Display takes precedence over Pilgrimage, canceling the normal resolution of “Resolve Ring Effects” and replacing it with the adjusted means of resolution. However, the Pilgrimage effect (“cancel all ring effects”) still cancels the Display of Power’s attempt to resolve the ring for the defender. The defender claims the ring.

- Because Display of Power interacts with the “Resolve Ring Effects” step rather than the specific effect chosen by the attacker, the attacker does not have the option to choose a specific ring effect to resolve when [Seeker of Knowledge](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/seeker-of-knowledge) is attacking (or whether they would like to resolve a ring effect at all). When Display of Power resolves the ring effect, the defender has the opportunity to choose which ring effect they would like to resolve instead, and may choose to not resolve the ring’s effect if they desire.

You cannot move a character to a conflict if that character cannot participate in that conflict (has a dash (–) for a skill, or a relevant constant ability, e.g. [Shiba Peacemaker](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/shiba-peacemaker), [Pacifism](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/pacifism)).
Once the new ring becomes the contested ring, the attacking player takes all fate on it.

If Endless Plains is broken to discard the only attacker, the conflict does not end immediately, but rather continues as normal. The defending player can declare defenders, and both players can play characters from hand into the conflict, or use card effects to put characters into play or move them to the conflict.

However, if both players count 0 skill during conflict resolution, the conflict resolves with no winner, and the contested ring is returned to the pool of unclaimed rings.

If Endless Plains is broken as a cost of its ability, even though technically its controller broke it, any card effects referencing the attacker or the conflict breaking a province can still trigger (e.g. [Shinjo Altansarnai](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/shinjo-altansarnai), [For Greater Glory](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/for-greater-glory), [Breakthrough](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/breakthrough)). The attacking player also can discard the dynasty card from the province.

In a Unicorn mirror match, if Endless Plains breaks as a cost of its ability ([step 4](https://fiveringsdb.com/rules/reference#initiating-abilities-playing-cards)), and [Shinjo Altansarnai](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/shinjo-altansarnai) is attacking, she can react to a province being broken ([nested ability sequence](https://fiveringsdb.com/rules/reference#nested-ability-sequences)), before she is chosen as a target (step 5) and discarded (step 7).
Reactions to winning/losing a conflict are played after the skill you won by is fixed. Playing Fallen in Battle will not help you win unopposed or break a province.

You cannot move a character to a conflict if that character cannot participate in that conflict (has a dash (–) for a skill, or a relevant constant ability, e.g. [Shiba Peacemaker](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/shiba-peacemaker), [Pacifism](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/pacifism)).
Your opponent must select an option that can change the game state (cannot choose to bow a bowed character, or dishonor a dishonored character).
If the effects of an ability are canceled, the ability is still considered to have been used, and any costs have still been paid.

Effects that modify the value of the honor bid (e.g. [Contingency Plan](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/contingency-plan), [Bayushi Manipulator](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/bayushi-manipulator)) only affect the current bid, the setting on the dial is not physically adjusted.

Duels physically adjust the setting on the dial, same way as honor bids during the Draw phase.

Grasp of Earth does not prevent characters from being 'put into play' in a conflict.

Certain ***Monk*** characters (e.g. [Tattoed Wanderer](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/tattooed-wanderer), [Togashi Kazue](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/togashi-kazue)) can still be played as attachments in the conflict.

The conflict ends only after all participating characters move home bowed, so Guest of Honor prevents your opponent from playing any events that react to winning/losing the conflict, breaking a province, resolving ring effects, or claiming the contested ring.
You cannot trigger Guidance of the Ancestors from your discard pile if you cannot pay the attachment's cost (to get the ability canceled by [Hida Kisada](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/hida-kisada)).
Height of Fashion can be played during the action window before a conflict (between steps 3.1 and 3.2), or during action windows in Draw, Fate, or Regroup phases.
The bonus provided by Hida Guardian is fixed upon resolution. If the number of holdings subsequently changes, the bonus is not affected.
If Hida Guardian leaves the conflict after using his ability, the lasting effect will persist regardless.
Hida Kisada can only cancel **Action:** abilities, not Reactions or Interrupts.
Hiruma Yōjimbō cannot be declared as an attacker, but can be moved to a conflict on the attacking side by card effects.

Effects that modify the value of the honor bid (e.g. [Contingency Plan](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/contingency-plan), [Bayushi Manipulator](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/bayushi-manipulator)) only affect the current bid, the setting on the dial is not physically adjusted.

Duels physically adjust the setting on the dial, same way as honor bids during the Draw phase.

Ide Trader's ability can only be triggered after a character is moved to a conflict by a card ability that uses the word "move" (or "[switch](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/master-of-swift-waves)"). Declaring a character as an attacker or defender, playing or putting a character into play in the conflict, are not considered to be "moving" that character.
Ikoma Eiji's ability cannot put characters straight into the conflict (specifically, you cannot combo it with [Deathseeker](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/deathseeker)).
Isawa Atsuko's ability only affects characters that are already participating in the conflict. Any characters that enter the conflict after her ability has resolved are not affected.
When an effect instructs a player to resolve multiple ring effects the first player chooses the order in which they resolve.
Isawa Kaede does not let you resolve Void twice - a ring either has a certain element, or it doesn't.
Glory count happens before the conflict phase ends, so Isawa Mori Seidō can help you claim the Imperial Favor.
Ishiken Initiate gets a bonus for each ring claimed by any player. The currently contested ring does not count.
When counting a current skill total, ignore bowed characters, but take Imperial Favor into account.
Keeper Initiate reacts to claiming the ring, which occurs after the ring effects resolve (you cannot put him into play, then honor him via the Fire ring).

Keeper Initiate's ability **can** be triggered after you claim a ring that gained the relevant element temporarily during a conflict (e.g. via [Seeker of Knowledge](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/seeker-of-lnowledge), [Isawa Kaede](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/isawa-kaede)).
"Max 1 per conflict" means that you can only trigger one Kitsuki Investigator per conflict, even if you control several of them.
Changing the conflict type does not affect what other conflicts the attacker can declare. What matters is which conflict type was originally declared.
When the conflict type is switched, any characters that cannot participate in the conflict of the new type (have a dash (–) for a skill, or have Pacifism attached) immediately go home bowed.
Once the new ring becomes the contested ring, the attacking player takes all fate on it.
Your opponent must select an option that can change the game state (cannot choose to give fate is he has none).
The Pride keyword resolves immediately when the conflict winner is determined, before any Reactions to winning/losing a conflict can be used.
Only one character can be declared as a defender, but other characters can be played into or moved to the conflict.
The bonus provided by Mountain's Anvil Castle is fixed upon resolution. If the number of attachments subsequently changes, the bonus is not affected.
You can attach a third Restricted attachment to Niten Master, discard one of them so that there are only two left, then trigger Niten Master's ability.
Niten Master can trigger whenever a ***Weapon*** attachment becomes attached to him (even if the effect says "move" etc.)
You can play Obstinate Recruit if you are less honorable than an opponent, but it will immediately be discarded.
Outwit can target a character with a dash (–) for political skill (treat dash as 0).

Bowed characters do not contribute their skill whenever you count skill totals, but they still have their individual skill values (for duels, [Outwit](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/outwit)/[Rout](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/rout), etc.)

Bowed characters do not contribute their skill whenever you count skill totals, but they still have their individual skill values (for duels, [Outwit](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/outwit)/[Rout](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/rout), etc.)

You can only choose and discard cards if you actually have enough cards.

You can either give honor or discard cards, but not a combination of both.
Duelist Training can be used to challenge a character to a duel, even if one or both of the participants are already bowed.

Bowed characters do not contribute their skill whenever you count skill totals, but they still have their individual skill values (for duels, [Outwit](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/outwit)/[Rout](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/rout), etc.)

Bowed characters do not contribute their skill whenever you count skill totals, but they still have their individual skill values (for duels, [Outwit](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/outwit)/[Rout](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/rout), etc.)
Rout can target a character with a dash (–) for military skill (treat dash as 0).

Bowed characters do not contribute their skill whenever you count skill totals, but they still have their individual skill values (for duels, [Outwit](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/outwit)/[Rout](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/rout), etc.)
Pacifism can be played during the action window before a conflict (between steps 3.1 and 3.2), or during action windows in Draw, Fate, or Regroup phases.
If attached character somehow ends up participating in a military conflict, it immediately goes home bowed.
Radiant Orator's ability is not a Glory Count, so it does not take claimed rings or [The Imperial Palace](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/the-imperial-palace) into account.
Changing the conflict type does not affect what other conflicts the attacker can declare. What matters is which conflict type was originally declared.
When the conflict type is switched, any characters that cannot participate in the conflict of the new type (have a dash (–) for a skill, or have Pacifism attached) immediately go home bowed.
Savvy Politician triggers when it changes status from Dishonored to Ordinary, or from Ordinary to Honored  ("is honored" is different from "becomes honored").

If you use Secret Cache to find an event card with a reaction to a conflict being declared (e.g. [Mantra of Fire](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/mantra-of-fire)), you can play it during the same reaction window.

Seeker Initiate's ability can be triggered after you claim a ring that gained the relevant element temporarily during a conflict (e.g. via [Seeker of Knowledge](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/seeker-of-knowledge), [Isawa Kaede](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/isawa-kaede)).
Shameful Display can only be triggered if there are at least 2 eligible targets (participating characters that can each be either honored or dishonored; eligibility is assessed individually).
If Shiba Peacemaker somehow ends up participating as an attacker (e.g. [Blackmailed](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/blackmail)), he immediately goes home bowed.
*"When the phase ends"* interrupts trigger before *"until the end of the phase"* lasting effects expire, and before *"at the end of the phase"* delayed effects resolve.
When an effect instructs a player to resolve multiple ring effects the first player chooses the order in which they resolve.
If the effects of an ability are canceled, the ability is still considered to have been used, and any costs have still been paid.

Shiba Yōjimbō cancels the effects of an ability when they initiate (in [step 6](https://fiveringsdb.com/rules/reference#initiating-abilities-playing-cards)) only if a Shugenja character has already been chosen as a target (in step 5; the ability's text must use the word "choose" before the dash (–) in the ability's text).

Some abilities choose targets when the effects resolve (in step 7; "choose" is after the dash, e.g. [Court Games](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/court-games), [Shosuro Miyako](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/shosuro-miyako)), at that point it is too late to cancel their initiation.

Shinjo Tatsuo's ability cannot be used if he is already participating in a conflict.

*The targering requirement is to choose himself and another character, but targets are only eligible if they can be affected by the ability's effects; since Shinjo Tatsuo cannot affect himself, he cannot choose himself as a target, which means that you cannot satisfy targeting requirements, so you cannot attempt to initiate the ability at all.*
Shiro Nishiyama only affects characters that are already participating in the conflict. Any characters that enter the conflict after the ability has resolved are not affected.
Your opponent must select an option that can change the game state (cannot choose to dishonor a dishonored character).

If your opponent selects the option to dishonor a character, the target is chosen during the resolution of the ability's effects. At that point it is too late to cancel the initiation of effects (e.g. via [Shiba Yōjimbō](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/shiba-yojimbo)).

*Note that this is a non-standard template, usually you choose targets before the opportunity to cancel the initiation of effects (the word "choose" is usually printed before the dash (–) in the ability's text).*

If the pre-dash sacrifice is prevented (e.g. by [Reprieve](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/reprieve)), the ability is prevented from initiating. The event remains unplayed in its owner's hand. A failed initiation attempt does not count towards Limits and Maximums. The opportunity to act is passed to the opponent.
Steadfast Witch Hunter can sacrifice itself to ready another character (the ability doesn't say choose *another* character).
If a character “cannot receive dishonored status tokens,” then those tokens cannot be placed on or moved to that character. That character cannot be dishonored if it is ordinary.
The bonus provided by Supernatural Storm is fixed upon resolution. If the number of your Shugenja characters subsequently changes, the bonus is not affected.

Characters played as attachments do not provide their printed skills as bonuses. 

They lack the “+” or “–” symbol before the value, so do not add their skills to the attached character. And only characters contribute their skill to a conflict (Tattooed Wanderer is considered to be an attachment rather than a character).
A card can have multiple instances of the same keyword, but functions as if it has one instance of that keyword.

Characters played as attachments do not provide their printed skills as bonuses. 

They lack the “+” or “–” symbol before the value, so do not add their skills to the attached character. And only characters contribute their skill to a conflict (Togashi Kazue is considered to be an attachment rather than a character).

If Togashi Yokuni has [Way of the Dragon](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/way-of-the-dragon) attached, he cannot use his own ability twice (because it says "Max", not "Limit"), but he can use the gained ability twice.

"Max" is per ability per card title per player. If Togashi Yokuni gains the ability of [Kitsuki Investigator](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/kitsuki-investigator), both characters can use that ability this round (they have different titles). If Yokuni gains the ability of an opponent's Yokuni, he cannot use that ability (no infinite loop).

source: RRG "In Play and Out of Play"
text:
If Togashi Yokuni gains an ability that potentially allows him to enter a players hand of conflict cards (eg. [Adept of Shadows](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/adept-of-shadows)), the ability will not allow him to actually enter the conflict hand. He would instead enter his owner's discard pile.

*This is a reversal to a previous ruling.*
Togashi Yokuni can gain an ability printed on a character that is blanked by [Cloud the Mind](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/cloud-the-mind).

Doubling modifiers apply after all +/- modifiers, regardless of the order of application of effects. So if you trigger Vengeful Berserker's ability, then give him a +X skill bonus, that bonus is doubled.
Vengeful Oathkeeper can only enter play at home via its ability, not in the conflict.
If the effects of an ability are canceled, the ability is still considered to have been used, and any costs have still been paid.

Warrior Poet's ability only affects characters that are already participating in the conflict. Any characters that enter the conflict after the ability has resolved are not affected.

If Warrior Poet leaves the conflict after using her ability, the lasting effect will persist regardless.
Players play cards from hand, or from provinces during the dynasty phase. Putting cards into play via card effects, or using abilities on non-Event cards, is not considered to be playing those cards.

If a player plays a card whose effects result in Watch
Commander being discarded, its ability cannot be triggered
as it is no longer in play.

If a player plays a card whose effects result in the attached
character no longer participating in the conflict, Watch
Commander’s ability cannot be triggered as the triggering
condition is no longer met.
Way of the Dragon does not work with abilities that say "Max X per [period]" ("Limit" applies to one particular card, "Max" applies to all cards with the same title).

When you play two copies of Way of the Lion on the same character during a conflict, that character’s military skill will be doubled twice (to now be quadruple the original skill value). The new base skill value continues to double if additional copies are played.

If you choose a ring that gained other elements during a conflict (e.g. via [Seeker of Knowledge](seeker-of-knowledge), [Isawa Kaede](isawa-kaede)), the effect will prevent your opponent from initiating conflicts with any of those elements until the end of the phase.
Yogo Hiroue can move bowed characters to a conflict (the ability doesn't say "choose a *ready* character").

Yogo Hiroue can target participating characters, or characters that cannot participate in the conflict (eg. has a dash (–) for a skill, or a relevant constant ability, e.g. [Shiba Peacemaker](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/shiba-peacemaker)).

Yound Rumormonger cannot redirect honor to an honored character (or dishonor to a dishonored character), because the ability would not affect that character at all, thus it would not be an eligible target.
Yōjin no Shiro only affects characters that are already attacking. Any characters that enter the conflict after the ability has resolved are not affected.

Neither the honoring nor the dishonoring aspect of Shameful Display’s ability is dependent upon the other. Additionally, targets for the ability may be chosen even if one or both of those characters could be either honored or dishonored (you do not need to select which character is receiving which aspect when choosing targets). If Shameful Display honors/dishonors one character and fails to honor/dishonor the other, it has still resolved successfully, even though it failed to affect one of the chosen characters. That character is still a valid target for the ability as it could have been affected by either aspect at the time it was chosen.

An Ancestral attachment only goes to your hand if the card it is attached to leaves play. If an Ancestral attachmentis is discarded by a card effect (e.g. [Let Go](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/let-go) or [Miya Mystic](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/miya-mystic)) or due to a character having three of more Restricted atachments, it goes into the discard pile as normal.

An Ancestral attachment only goes to your hand if the card it is attached to leaves play. If an Ancestral attachmentis is discarded by a card effect (e.g. [Let Go](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/let-go) or [Miya Mystic](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/miya-mystic)) or due to a character having three of more Restricted atachments, it goes into the discard pile as normal.

If you take control of an Ancestral attachment (e.g. via [Calling in Favors](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/calling-in-favors)), when the card it is attached to leaves play, the attachment goes to its owner's hand.

If you take control of an Ancestral attachment (e.g. via [Calling in Favors](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/calling-in-favors)), when the card it is attached to leaves play, the attachment goes to its owner's hand.

If a card leaves play and re-enters play during the same period, it is considered a new instance of the card and there is no memory of having used the ability during the specified period. (This rule also applies to any ability with no specified limit.)

If you take control of Adept of Shadows (e.g. via [Blackmail](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/blackmail) or [Shosuro Actress](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/shosuro-actress)) and use its ability, it goes to its owner's hand.
If you take control of Court Mask (e.g. via [Calling in Favors](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/calling-in-favors)) and use its ability, it goes to its owner's hand.
Seeker of Enlightenment gets a bonus for each ring in the unclaimed ring pool. The currently contested ring does not count.

You cannot trigger an action ability to 'use up' Hida Kisada's cancel, if the triggered ability does not change the game state (eg. [Yōjin no Shiro](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/yojin-no-shiro) while defending, or [Shiro Nishiyama](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/shiro-nishiyama) while attacking).

*"A triggered ability can only be initiated if its **effect** has the potential to change the game state on its own."* 

(Effect is denoted after the dash (–) in the ability's text.)
*"Its owner"* refers to the owner of the targeted character.

If you take control of a participating character that cannot participate in the current conflict on your side (e.g. [Shiba Peacemaker](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/shiba-peacemaker)), it immediately bows and goes home.
Rings have three disticts states - claimed, unclaimed, and contested. A contested ring is neither claimed not unclaimed. You cannot play Know the World to switch the contested ring.
Togashi Yokuni cannot gain the ability of [Togashi Kazue](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/togashi-kazue). Kazue has a constant ability while she's a character, not a triggered ability.

If a conflict is declared as political but is then switched to military (or vice versa), it counts as both a military conflict and a political conflict having occured this round. Any subsequent military conflict will not be the first one this round.
Hiruma Ambusher prevents **Action:**, **Reaction:**, and **Interrupt:** abilities from being triggered. Constant abilities and keywords are not affected.

Guidance of the Ancestors is still bound by the general "limit once per round" rule. So if you trigger its ability and it gets canceled by [Hida Kisada](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/hida-kisada), you cannot trigger it again this round.

Leaving play resets the limit. So if you play Guidance of the Ancestors from the discard pile, then it gets discarded from play (e.g. by [Let Go](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/let-go)), you can use its ability again this same round.

The general "once per round" limit applies to each ability granted by a specific copy of Duelist Training to a specific character.

One character can use abilities provided by multiple copies of Duelist Training (they are considered to be different abilities, since they are provided by different attachments). If the same copy of Dueling Training leaves and re-enters play, it is considered to be a new copy (leaving play resets the limit).

If a character uses the ability provided by Duelist Training, then the attachment is moved to another character (by [Giver of Gifts](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/giver-of-gifts) or [Calling in Favors](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/calling-in-favors)), that other character can use the ability (it is considered to be a different ability, since it is on a different character).

If a character uses the ability provided by Duelist Training, then the attachment is moved to another character, then back to the original character, that character cannot use the ability again (it is considered to be the same ability, since it is provided by the same attachment to the same character).
The province stronghold also counts. Each player has 5 provinces.

Togashi Yokuni can only target characters in play, not in provinces or discard piles.

*Card abilities only interact with, and can only target, cards that are in play, unless the ability specifically refers to an out-of-play area or element.*
Kakita Yoshi's ability can only be used if you control the Imperial Favor. Discarding it is a cost of the ability.
When you discard the Imperial Favor, return it to the unclaimed state.
High Kick prevents **Action:**, **Reaction:**, and **Interrupt:** abilities from being triggered. Constant abilities and keywords are not affected.

When counting a current skill total, ignore bowed characters, but take Imperial Favor into account.

Crisis Breaker only counts the skill of characters participating in the conflict.

Fate stays on rings even while they're contested or claimed.

When attached character becomes bowed, your opponents do not take fate from contested or claimed rings. Fate is only taken when a ring transitions to the contested state.
Only printed text is blanked. Text gained from another source is not blanked.

Tranquility applies a lasting effect *"Cannot use triggered abilities"* to each character that is at your opponent's home during the event's resolution. It does not create a blanket effect.

If a character enters the opponent's home after Tranquility resolves, it can trigger its abilities, because it was not affected.

If a character that was at the opponent's home when Tranquility resolved is moved to the conflict, it cannot trigger its abilities, because the lasting effect still applies to it.
Sacrificing a friendly character is the cost of Noble Sacrifice. By the time the ability's effects can be cancelled, costs have already been paid, and a friendly character has aready been sacrificed.

Way of the Crab can be played during an action window in any phase of the round, including the Dynasty phase (you can use an eligible "**Action:**" ability instead of playing a character from a province), and the Fate phase (after characters with no fate are discarded).

Sacrificing a friendly character is the cost of Way of the Crab. By the time the ability's effects can be cancelled, costs have already been paid, and a friendly character has already been sacrificed.
Losing 1 honor is the cost of Captive Audience. By the time the ability's effects can be cancelled, costs have already been paid, and honor has already been lost.
Shosuro Actress cannot put an opponent's unique character into play if you or that opponent already own or control another copy of that character in play.
A Blackmailed character is considered to be *friendly*, and can be sacrificed to pay the cost of certain abilities (e.g. [Noble Sacrifice](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/noble-sacrifice)).

Vengeful Berserker does not double the bid value during a duel.

*During a duel, the bid on a player’s honor dial is applied
as a modifier independently of the normal process of
calculating modifiers, and is added after doubling and/or halving modifiers are calculated.*
If the card revealed by Artisan Academy is moved to another game zone and is no longer the top card of the deck, the lasting effect applying to it expires, and you can no longer play it.
If Kitsuki Yaruma enters play during a conflict (e.g. via [Charge!](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/charge)) and turns the attacked province facedown, it is immediately turned faceup.

Know the World does not trigger [Keeper Initiate](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/keeper-initiate) or [Seeker Initiate](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/seeker-initiate) (you do not claim the ring, you just place it into your claimed pool).

Enlightened Warrior can only trigger after an opponent selects a ring with fate on it when declaring a conflict. Switching rings via card effects (e.g. [Know the World](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/know-the-world)) does not trigger him.

If Young Rumormonger is used to change the recipient of dishonor when paying costs, the cost is still considered to be paid (e.g. [Forged Edict](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/forged-edict), [Spies at Court](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/spies-at-court), [Calling in Favors](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/calling-in-favors)).
Yogo Hiroue's delayed effect (*"if you win the conflict..."*) applies simultaneously with the Pride keyword. (First player would determine order).

If Otomo Courtier somehow ends up participating in a military conflict (conflict type switched), or participating as an attacker against a player that controls the Imperial Favor (e.g. [Blackmailed](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/blackmail)), it immediately goes home bowed.

If Seppun Guardsman somehow ends up participating in a political conflict (conflict type switched), or participating as an attacker against a player that controls the Imperial Favor (e.g. [Blackmailed](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/blackmail)), he immediately goes home bowed.
Young Rumormonger can redirect the Fire ring effect to [Isawa Kaede](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/isawa-kaede).
If a ***Magistrate*** makes some characters not count their skill toward the resolution of the conflict, they don't count for Crisis Breaker's ability  either.
Kaiu Shuichi can trigger if there is any holding in play, even one controlled by your opponent.
Shrewd Yasuki can trigger if there is any holding in play, even one controlled by your opponent.
Ide Trader's ability can be triggered after he himself is moved to a conflict.
Immunity only protects from effects. A card that is immune to events can still be used to pay an event card’s cost.

Event effects can still affect an immune card indirectly, by affecting its peripheral entities (tokens, attachments, triggered abilities), e.g.:
- [Consumed by Five Fires](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/consumed-by-five-fires) can remove fate from an immune card.
- [Calling in Favors](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/calling-in-favors) can dishonor an immune card (as a cost) and attach an attachment to it.

Keeper Initiate's ability cannot be triggered while he is in play.

*If the pre-Then aspect of an effect does not successfully resolve in full, the post-Then aspect does not attempt to resolve.*

Finger of Jade can only cancel an ability that uses the word "choose" in its text. If the effects of an ability are canceled, the ability is still considered to have been used, and any costs have still been paid.

Finger of Jade cancels the effects of an ability when they initiate (in [step 6](https://fiveringsdb.com/rules/reference#initiating-abilities-playing-cards)) only if attached character has already been chosen as a target (in step 5; the ability's text must use the word "choose" before the dash (–) in the ability's text).

Some abilities choose targets when the effects resolve (in step 7; "choose" is after the dash, e.g. [Court Games](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/court-games), [Shosuro Miyako](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/shosuro-miyako)), at that point it is too late to cancel their initiation.
Raise the Alarm cannot be played if all cards in the attacked province are already faceup.
If you Blackmail a character that has already used its ability, you can use it again. Limits and Maximums are player-specific.

Reactions to a conflict being declared, to attackers committing to the conflict, and to a province being revealed, all share the same reaction window (first player gets the first opportunity to trigger their reaction).

If a character with Spyglass attacks [Restoration of Balance](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/restoration-of-balance), the first player gets the first opportunity to trigger reactions. If the attacker is the first player, they can pass on reactions, wait for the defender to use the province, then trigger Spyglass.

Reactions to a conflict being declared, to attackers committing to the conflict, and to a province being revealed, all share the same reaction window (first player gets the first opportunity to trigger their reaction).
If you pass your first conflict opportunity, you cannot declare your second conflict, so you cannot play Breakthrough.
Borderlands Defender can be bowed by the Water ring effect. Ring effects are not card effects. (revelant for [The Mountain Does Not Fall](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/the-mountain-does-not-fall))

Pilgrimage cancels ALL ring effects, including those initiated by card effects (e.g. [Display of Power](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/display-of-power), [Akodo Toturi](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/akodo-toturi), [Doji Hotaru](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/doji-hotaru), [Guardian Kami](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/guardian-kami), [Kami Unleashed](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/kami-unleashed)).

The [sequence](https://fiveringsdb.com/rules/reference#initiating-abilities-playing-cards) of playing A Legion of One:

- Announce playing A Legion of One
- Step 5: Choose a target
- Step 6: Effects initiate (if canceled, stop here)
- Step 7: Effects resolve - Target gets +3 mil. You may remove 1 fate from it. If you do, continue:
- Step 5b: Choose a target
- Step 6b: Effects initiate (if canceled, stop here)
- Step 7b: Effects resolve - Target gets +3 mil. You may remove 1 fate from it. If you do, nothing happens.

Removing1 fate to "resolve the ability twice" is an optional part of the card's effect, not a cost.

A Legion of One can be canceled in step 6 (before any effects resolve) or in step 6b (after the target gets +3 mil and loses 1 fate).
If Akodo Toshiro leaves the conflict after using his ability, the lasting effect will persist regardless.

To initiate Ide Tadaji's ability, you must be able to choose one eligible character per player.

When you play Know the World, you take a ring from the unclaimed ring pool and place it in your claimed ring pool same side up as the ring that you are returning.

Then you play Know the World and switch your claimed Air ring with an unclaimed Earth ring. You place the Earth ring to your claimed ring pool retaining the Air ring's conflict type - military side up.*

If [Waning Hostilities](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/waning-hostilities) was played this phase, Breakthrough cannot be played.

Master Of Gisei Toshi instructs you to target a physical ring. If another ring gains the element of the chosen ring (via [Seeker of Knowledge](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/seeker-of-knowledge) or [Isawa Kaede](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/isawa-kaede)), the Master's effect does not apply.
Along the River of Gold cannot switch base skills on a character that has a dash (–) for a skill (dash values cannot be modified or changed).

Iron Mine’s effect can prevent a character from being sacrificed.

If that occurs during the payment of a cost, then that cost is not considered to have been paid as the sacrifice was prevented. If the sacrifice while paying an event’s cost is prevented, the effects do not initiate and that event remains unplayed in its owner’s hand.

If that occurs during the resolution of an effect, then nothing is dependent upon whether or not the sacrifice resolved successfully. In the same way that an event whose effects were canceled by [Voice of Honor](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/voice-of-honor) is still considered to have been played, a card like [Way of the Crab](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/way-of-the-crab) is still considered to have been played even if its effects are prevented by Reprieve.
"***Seeker***/***Keeper*** only" is a deckbuilding restriction. You can take control of cards that do not match your role.

If Along the River of Gold is turned faceup, you can trigger its ability during a conflict at another Water province. If it is facedown, you cannot voluntarily turn it faceup; provinces only turn faceup when they are attacked.

If you play Test of Skill from the top of your deck (with a card such as [Artisan Academy](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/artisan-academy) or [Pillow Book](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/pillow-book)), it will take up one of the “revealed card slots” in its cost, but be ineligible to be put into your hand by its effect.

- When an event card is played, it is considered to remain in its original zone until its cost has successfully been payed, at which point it gets placed onto the table in a state of “being played” before being placed in its owner’s discard pile after its effects resolve. Therefore, during the payment of the Test of Skill’s cost, it is still on top of your deck and will be revealed as part of the cost of playing the event.

- While it is already revealed by the Academy or Pillow Book, it can still be revealed again to satisfy its own cost. However, once it leaves the top of your deck (after paying costs and choosing targets in step 5—see ‘[Initiating Abilities](https://fiveringsdb.com/rules/reference#initiating-abilities-playing-cards)’), it no longer becomes “one of the revealed cards” and cannot be put back into your hand. For more information, see ‘[In Play and Out of Play](https://fiveringsdb.com/rules/reference#in-play-and-out-of-play)’.
Resolving ring effects *as the attacking player* is optional. You may choose not to resolve the ring effect, and just claim the ring.

If Miya Satoshi fails to find any ***Imperial*** cards, and discards your whole deck, the rest of the effect fizzles. You do not lose 5 honor or reshuffle the discard pile into the deck - you only do that when you refill provinces or draw cards.

Fushichō's ability resolves while it is still in play. It cannot put into play another copy of itself, because it's unique.

*When a triggering condition initiates (but before it completes its resolution), an interrupt window for that triggering condition opens. Always resolve interrupts to a triggering condition before resolving the consequences of the triggering condition itself.*
If Fushichō leaves play during a conflict, it cannot put another character into play in the conflict, only at home.

Katana of Fire does not give a skill bonus for [Keeper of Fire](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/keeper-of-fire) and [Seeker of Fire](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/seeker-of-fire) roles, because they are not in play.

Embrace the Void can only be played if you control a Shugenja character **in play**.

*Card abilities only interact with, and can only target, cards that are in play, unless the ability specifically refers to an out-of-play area or element.*

If [Chasing the Sun](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/chasing-the-sun) or [Talisman of the Sun](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/talisman-of-the-sun) are used to move the contested ring to Endless Plains, the province's ability cannot be triggered, because an attack is not being declared.

If [Chasing the Sun](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/chasing-the-sun) or [Talisman of the Sun](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/talisman-of-the-sun) are used to move the contested ring to Secret Cache, the province's ability cannot be triggered, because an attack is not being declared.

If [Endless Plains](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/endless-plains) is broken via its ability, Along the River of Gold can still be triggered. Broken provinces retain their elemental affiliation, as it is not a part of their text.

Kyūden Isawa cannot be used to play spells with a reaction ability (eg. [Display of Power](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/display-of-power)).  
You have to resolve the Spell as an action, which reactions cannot do.

If there are fewer than 3 cards in the opponent's deck, you can resolve the effects in whatever order you want. For example, you can discard one card and put another one on the bottom of the deck, and not put anything on top.
Borderlands Fortifications cannot switch places with the stronghold.
Losing 1 honor to "resolve the ability twice" is an optional part of the card's effect, not a cost.

Way of the Lion and [Bayushi Yunako](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/bayushi-yunako) interact in timestamp order (no layers). If you play Way of the Lion first, then trigger Yunako, the affected character will have a new base political skill equal to double its original base (printed) military skill.

If the Crane player wins the Imperial Favor, but the Scorpion player is going to discard [Fawning Diplomat](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/fawning-diplomat) during the fate phase, whether Doji Shizue is discarded or not depends on who is the first player.

During the fate phase, the first player discards his characters with no fate first (one by one), then the second player, then 1 fate is removed from each remaining character simultaneously.
If a player plays Display of Power after [Isawa Kaede](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/isawa-kaede) wins the conflict as an attacker, that player gets to resolve all of the contested ring's effects.

If a Unicorn character gains another clan affiliation (e.g. via [Seal of the Crab](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/seal-of-the-crab)), it is still a Unicorn character, and thus not an eligible target for Gaijin Customs.

If a Scorpion character gains another clan affiliation (e.g. via [Seal of the Crab](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/seal-of-the-crab)), it is still a Scorpion character, and thus not an eligible target for Way of the Scorpion.

The defending player chooses the element from the options available to the attacking player, i.e. among the unclaimed rings, and accounting for any restrictions (e.g. [Way of the Phoenix](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/way-of-the-phoenix)).
"Cannot be discarded" does not prevent Doji Shizue from being sacrificed for [Way of the Crab](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/way-of-the-crab). 'Discard' and 'sacrifice' are different game terms.
The entire effect of Clarity of Purpose lasts until the end of the conflict.

You need an eligible card to move fate to, in order to play Karmic Twist. You cannot move fate from a character to nowhere.

*When an entity moves, it cannot move to its same (current) placement. If there is no valid destination for a move, the move attempt cannot be made.*
The attacking player is still the one who 'selects' the ring, so the defending player can trigger [Enlightened Warrior](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/enlightened-warrior).

You can play [Know the World](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/know-the-world) and interrupt its resolution with Wholeness of the World. You will add a new ring to your claimed ring pool without giving up the one you already had.

Isawa Tadaka prevents the opponent from using cards effects that play cards from the conflict discard pile ([Kyūden Isawa](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/kyuden-isawa), [Togashi Mitsu](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/togashi-mitsu) etc.).
Mantis Tenkinja can let you play an event card that costs 1 when you have 0 fate.

If Feral Ningyo's ability is canceled by [Hida Kisada](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/hida-kisada), you can use it again.

Cards in hidden game areas (e.g. in hand) have no card memory, so Limits do not apply to them.

If you use [Guardian Kami](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/guardian-kami) or [Kami Unleashed](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/kami-unleashed) while Isawa Kaede is attacking, you only get to resolve one ring effect (of your choice). Kaede did not actually win this conflict, so her "resolve all ring effects" ability does not apply.
Kaito Kosori does not contribute her skill while at home if she is bowed, or if a relevant ***Magistrate*** is present in the conflict.
During conflicts at [Sanpuku Seidō](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/sanpuku-seido), Kaito Kosori counts her glory.
The Imperial Favor bonus still applies during conflicts at Sanpuku Seidō.
Kamayari does not target (does not say "choose"), so it cannot be cancelled by [Finger of Jade](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/finger-of-jade).
Support of the Phoenix can only be used on its own, it cannot be used along a ***Keeper/Seeker*** role.

When your opponent plays an event, first you get a chance to cancel its effects (with e.g. [Voice of Honor](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/voice-of-honor)), then you can trigger Shigeru's ability and make the opponent discard a card.
When Yogo Kikuyo's ability is used, she can only enter play at home, not in a conflict.

A ring affected by Secluded Shrine counts as a claimed ring for [Prodigy of the Waves](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/prodigy-of-the-waves), [Solemn Scholar](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/solemn-scholar), [Henshin Disciple](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/henshin-disciple), and [Ishiken Initiate](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/ishiken-initiate).

However, affecting a ring by Secluded Shrine does not count as claiming a ring for [Keeper](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/keeper-initiate)/[Seeker Initiate](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/seeker-initiate) or [Asako Tsuki](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/asako-tsuki).

A ring affected by Secluded Shrine counts towards the Imperial Favor contest. If you use Shrine on a ring and then claim it, it only counts once. If you use Shrine on a ring and your opponent claims it, it counts for both players.
While at Sanpuku Seidō, any skill counts (e.g. [Kakita Asami](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/kakita-asami), [Crisis Breaker](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/crisis-breaker)) count glory instead.
While at Sanpuku Seidō, [Magistrates](https://fiveringsdb.com/cards/search?q=Magistrate) prevent relevant characters from counting their glory.

If you take control of an opponent's unique attachment (e.g. [Talisman of the Sun](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/talisman-of-the-sun)), neither player can play another copy of that attachment (because each player either owns or controls a copy in play).
If you take control of an opponent's unique attachment, neither player can play another copy of that attachment (because each player either owns or controls a copy in play).

"Discard if military skill is 0" is a part of the lasting effect that applies until the end of the conflict. If Aramoro's ability doesn't lower the character down to 0 skill immediately, but a subsequent effect during the same conflict does, the character will be discarded.

If a replacement effect is used to prevent the character from leaving play (e.g. [Reprieve](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/reprieve), [Stand Your Ground](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/stand-your-ground)) but does not concurrently increase its military skill above 0, Aramoro's effect will immediately reapply, and the character will be discarded again.

If Bayushi Aramoro leaves the conflict after using his ability, the lasting effect will persist regardless.
Stolen Breath can be played during the action window before a conflict (between steps 3.1 and 3.2), or during action windows in Draw, Fate, or Regroup phases.
If attached character somehow ends up participating in a political conflict, it immediately goes home bowed.
Infiltrator cannot be used to play **Reaction** or **Interrupt** events.

Shinjo Shono's ability only affects characters that are already participating in the conflict. Any characters that enter the conflict (or gain/lose the ***Cavalry*** trait) after the ability has resolved are not affected.

If Shinjo Shono leaves the conflict after using her ability, the lasting effect will persist regardless.
Sneaky Shinjo's ability says "play" (not "put into play"), so when you use it, you need to pay for him, and you can add fate to him.
When a ring is claimed, it is placed in your claimed pool indicating the type of the ongoing conflict.
Hisu Mori Toride allows you to initiate an additional military conflict, in addition to your standard one military and one political conflicts (so for a total ot 3 conflicts).

Waning Hostilities limits each player to one conflict opportunity for the phase. Because Waning Hostilities sets a hard limit, no amount of additional conflicts gained through card effects can allow players to declare more than one conflict in that phase.
Kudaka can be triggered after you claim a non-Air ring that has the Air element via [Seeker of Knowledge](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/seeker-of-knowledge).

- Duty cancels the initiation of any effect that makes you lose honor. It cannot cancel costs though (e.g. [Assassination](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/assassination)).

- If you play Duty to cancel honor loss from [Backhanded Compliment](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/backhanded-compliment), you still get to draw a card.

- If you play Duty to cancel honor loss from resolving [Banzai!](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/banzai) twice, the second resolution is prevented.

- If you play Duty to cancel honor transfer (from an honor bid, the Air ring effect, or [Levy](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/levy)), both honor loss and honor gain are prevented.

- If you play Duty to cancel the honor loss from running out of cards, you place it in the discard pile first, then shuffle and draw a card / refill a province.

The Mirror's Gaze says "ignore costs and triggering conditions". Costs are instructions like "Bow", "Spend", "Sacrifice", etc. Triggering conditions say "After", "When", "If". All of these are ignored. However, the pre-dash part of an ability might also contain play restrictions ("During", "While"), targeting requirements ("Choose"), or selections ("Select") - these are not ignored and must be fulfilled.

The Mirror's Gaze cannot copy an event if its effects or targeting requirements reference its cost or triggered condition (by using the words "it", "that", or "those") (exception: [Calling in Favors](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/calling-in-favors), see below).

The Mirror's Gaze cannot be used to copy the following events, either because their effects or targeting requirements reference their costs or triggering conditions (by using the words "it", "that", or "those"), or because they have play restrictions ("During", "While") that cannot be fulfilled by both players at the same time:

- Interrupts: any whose effects cancel a card effect or framework
step.
- Reactions: [Curry Favor](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/curry-favor), [Display of Power](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/display-of-power), [Indomitable Will](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/indomitable-will), [Ready for Battle](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/ready-for-battle), [Way of the Chrysanthemum](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/way-of-the-chrysanthemum).
- Actions: [Chasing the Sun](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/chasing-the-sun), [Harmonize](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/harmonize), [I Am Ready](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/i-am-ready), [I Can Swim](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/i-can-swim), [Raise the Alarm](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/raise-the-alarm), [Rebuild](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/rebuild), [Strength in Numbers](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/strength-in-numbers), [Test of Skill](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/test-of-skill).

If the Air ring is affected by one player's Secluded Shrine, but is physically in another player's claimed pool, both players are considered to have it claimed. In this case, [Fū Sui Disciple](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/fu-sui-disciple)'s controller may choose against which player to resolve its ability.

If the Air ring is affected by one player's [Secluded Shrine](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/secluded-shrine), but is physically in another player's claimed pool, both players are considered to have it claimed. In this case, Fū Sui Disciple's controller may choose against which player to resolve its ability.

Shiba Yōjimbō cannot cancel the ability of [Shosuro Actress](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/shosuro-actress) that targets a ***Shugenja*** in a discard pile, because Yōjimbō does not "see" traits on cards out of play.

Menacing Iron Warrior's ability applies a lasting effect to a set of characters that meet the specified criteria (participating, lower military skill) at the moment the ability resolves. The lasting effect persists on affected characters until it expires at the end of the conflict, even if Menacing Iron Warrior leaves the conflict before that.
Set modifiers override all non-set modifiers (+/- and doubling/halving, even those applied afterwards), with the exception of the bid during a duel, which is always added after other calculations.
Set modifiers override all non-set modifiers (+/- and doubling/halving, even those applied afterwards), with the exception of the bid during a duel, which is always added after other calculations.

If an opponent's ability instructs a player to \*choose\* a target, the character affected by Spreading the Darkness cannot be chosen. This also applies to abilities that instruct another player to choose targets (e.g. [Court Games](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/court-games)).

Spreading the Darkness does not prevent the affected character from being sacrificed for [Way of the Crab](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/way-of-the-crab) (that event doesn't instruct a player to \*choose\* a character, so it's non-targeting).

Consumed by Five Fires does not target characters, so it can remove fate from characters that are protected from targeting ([Above Question](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/above-question), [Spreading the Darkness](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/spreading-the-darkness), [Finger of Jade](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/finger-of-jade)).

Master Alchemist can be used to place fate on the Fire ring while it is contested or claimed. Fate will stay on rings up until the point at which they become contested. If the ring is already being contested when fate is added to it, the attacker will not gain that fate.
Set modifiers override all non-set modifiers (+/- and doubling/halving, even those applied afterwards), with the exception of the bid during a duel, which is always added after other calculations.

If the initial dishonor effect is prevented, or redirected by [Young Rumormonger](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/young-rumormonger), the attached character will be dishonored by the second part of the effect.
If the initial honor effect is prevented, or redirected by [Young Rumormonger](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/young-rumormonger), the chosen character will be honored by the second part of the effect.
Young Rumormonger is not bound by any targeting restrictions of the ability that he is interrupting.
Unleash the Djinn only affects characters that are already participating in the conflict. Any characters that enter the conflict after the ability has resolved are not affected.
***Courtier*** characters cannot be declared as defenders, but can be played into the conflict from hand, and can be moved to the conflict by card effects.
Even the Odds can be played to honor a ***Commander*** character that is already participating in the conflict, or one that cannot be moved to the conflict (honoring is not dependent on moving).
"Ordinary" means neither honored nor dishonored.

While Kaito Kosori contributes her skill from home, she is not participating in the conflict. So if you win the conflict and she has [Honored Blade](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/honored-blade) attached, you cannot trigger it - she did not win the conflict, even though she contributed.
Smoke only affects characters that are already participating in the conflict. Any characters that enter the conflict after the ability has resolved are not affected.
Set modifiers override all non-set modifiers (+/- and doubling/halving, even those applied afterwards), with the exception of the bid during a duel, which is always added after other calculations.
Volcanic Troll gets the bonus while the Fire ring is in the unclaimed pool. Contested and unclaimed are different states.

Characters played as attachments do not provide their printed skills as bonuses. 

They lack the “+” or “–” symbol before the value, so do not add their skills to the attached character. And only characters contribute their skill to a conflict (Ancient Master is considered to be an attachment rather than a character).
Heartless Intimidator can be triggered after honor is transfered (given/taken) from an opponent.
Your honor dial remains set to the new value.

If attached character's glory becomes lower than 2 (e.g. due to [Isawa Mori Seidō](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/isawa-mori-seido)'s effect expiring), Formal Invitation becomes illegally attached and is discarded.

Soshi Shadowshaper cannot target character cards played as attachments (e.g. [Ancient Master](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/ancient-master), [Tattooed Wanderer](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/tattooed-wanderer)) - those are not characters while in play.
Isawa Uona triggers *after* the effects on an ***Air*** event resolve.
Sacred Sanctuary can be used on a ready ***Monk*** character. The lasting effect is not dependent on the character being readied.

Facedown characters created by Force of the River have no printed cost, therefore they cannot be [Assassinated](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/assassination) or [Blackmailed](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/blackmail), and are not affected by  [Stoic Magistrate](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/stoic-magistrate).
If you control a unique attachment, you can attempt to take control of another copy of that attachment. Since you cannot take control of it, it will be discarded.
If you control a unique attachment, you can attempt to take control of another copy of that attachment. Since you cannot take control of it, it will be discarded.
Isawa Uona can be triggered even if an ***Air*** event is canceled.

My Ancestor's Strength sets a character's *base* skill.  
Unlike normal "set" modifiers, non-set modifiers (eg. attachments, [Banzai!](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/banzai), etc) can still affect the total of a skill that has had its base value set.
Skills that have been set cannot be switched ([Along the River of Gold](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/along-the-river-of-gold), [Bayushi Yunako](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/bayushi-yunako)).
Skills that have been set cannot be switched ([Along the River of Gold](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/along-the-river-of-gold), [Bayushi Yunako](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/bayushi-yunako)).

- The Mirror's Gaze can copy [Breakthrough](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/breakthrough) only if you've already initiated or passed exactly one conflict this phase. After your opponent plays Breakthrough and you Mirror it, you must wait for them to resolve their second conflict, before you get to initiate yours (effectively you just skip action windows between conflicts).

- The Mirror's Gaze can copy [Calling in Favors](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/calling-in-favors). Since costs are ignored, there is no "that" character to attach the attachment to, so you have to discard it. 

- If The Mirror's Gaze copies an event with a Max (e.g. [Banzai!](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/banzai)), it counts towards the Max (so you cannot mirror an opponent's Banzai! and play a Banzai! of your own during the same conflict).

- [Isawa Tadaka](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/isawa-tadaka) does not prevent you from using The Mirror's Gaze to copy an opponent's event if you have another copy of it in your discard pile.

- When you use The Mirror's Gaze to copy an opponent's event, the copy is considered to be *your* event, so your opponent can use their own Mirror's Gaze to copy the copy.

- If The Mirror's Gaze copies a Limited event (e.g. [Dispatch](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/dispatch)), it is NOT considered to be your one Limited card per round.

Ancestral attachments only go to your hand if the card it is attached to leaves play. If an Ancestral attachmentis is discarded by a card effect (e.g. [Let Go](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/let-go) or [Miya Mystic](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/miya-mystic)) or due to a character having three of more Restricted atachments, it goes into the discard pile as normal.

An Ancestral attachment only goes to your hand if the card it is attached to leaves play. If an Ancestral attachmentis is discarded by a card effect (e.g. [Let Go](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/let-go) or [Miya Mystic](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/miya-mystic)) or due to a character having three of more Restricted atachments, it goes into the discard pile as normal.
If you use Border Fortress to reveal an opponent's province, your opponent can trigger its on-reveal ability (if it has any), not you.
Cards are discarded all at once. You cannot discard down to fewer than 4 cards.
Characters only trigger their own abilities. Abilities on attachments are triggered by players, not by characters.

If you win a conflict with two participating characters, and use [Hisu Mori Toride](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/hisu-mori-toride) to sacrifice one of them, you can still play Indomitable Will - the "attacking alone" restriction is checked when the event is played.

Inquisitive Ishika only reduces the cost of cards as they're being played. It does not reduce the cost of cards in play (e.g. for [Soshi Shadowshaper](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/soshi-shadowshaper)).

Shosuro Miyako can be triggered after a character is played "as if it were in your hand" (e.g. via [Infiltrator](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/infiltrator), [Hidden Moon Dōjō](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/hidden-moon-dojo)).

Soshi Shadowshaper effectively can only target characters with *printed* cost 2 or lower - card effects do not reduce the cost of cards already in play (e.g. [Inquisitive Ishika](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/inquisitive-ishika)).

Soshi Shadowshaper cannot be triggered after a character is played "as if it were in your hand" (e.g. via [Infiltrator](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/infiltrator), [Hidden Moon Dōjō](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/hidden-moon-dojo)).

Disguised Protector will add both players' bids to their skill, even if there are no characters participating.

However,
*A player must count at least 1 total skill and there must be
at least one participating character on his or her side in
order to win a conflict*
When Callow Delegate leaves play, it can honor itself to give you 1 honor.

Asako Azunami can be triggered when you would resolve the Water ring *effect*.

If you trigger Asako Azunami after [Isawa Kaede](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/isawa-kaede) wins a conflict, you still get to resolve the Void ring effect.

Asako Azunami can bow [Isawa Kaede](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/isawa-kaede) (a character ability is doing the bowing, not a ring effect).

When Master of Swift Waves swiches characters, a character in your home is considered to move to a conflict, so [Spyglass](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/spyglass) and [Ide Trader](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/ide-trader) can trigger.
When a province card is revealed by a card effect, it remains faceup until another card or game effect turns it facedown.
You cannot place additional fate on characters when you put them into play by card effects. You can only do that when you play characters from provinces or from hand.
[Finger of Jade](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/finger-of-jade) cannot cancel the effects of Mark of Shame (it doesn't target, doesn't use the word "choose").

You cannot move a character to a conflict if that character cannot participate in that conflict (has a dash (–) for a skill, or a relevant constant ability, e.g. [Shiba Peacemaker](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/shiba-peacemaker), [Pacifism](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/pacifism)).
If Web of Lies is being attacked by a lone [Cautious Scout](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/cautious-scout), its strength will be 0.
A player can look at the faces of cards, that they control, brought into play with Force of the River.
Facedown characters created by Force of the River are not given a clan symbol, so are considered Neutral characters.

Lion's Pride Brawler can bow a character that has a dash (-) for a military  skill.

*If a character has a dash for a skill value and a card ability
requires a numerical value for that skill, treat the card as if it
had an unmodifiable skill value of 0.*

If you attach [Cloud the Mind](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/cloud-the-mind) to a Reclusive Zokujin during an Earth conflict, the Zokujin will be immune to the text on Cloud the Mind until after the conflict ends (when the Zokujin's immunity will go away).

When Callow Delegate leaves play and honors itself while its controller also has an Asahina Storyteller in play, that player will draw a card for Sincerity, which resolves after the character leaves play.
Hisu Mori Toride allows you to initiate an additional military conflict, in addition to your standard one military and one political conflicts (for a total of 3 conflicts).

source: RRG "Appendix III: Card Clarifications: Waning Hostilities"
text: You cannot trigger Hisu Mori Toride after [Waning Hostilities](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/waning-hostilities) has been played. Waning Hostilities prevents players from declaring more than one conflict.

source: RRG "Appendix III: Card Clarifications: Waning Hostilities"
text: You cannot trigger Hisu Mori Toride after [Waning Hostilities](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/waning-hostilities) has been played. Waning Hostilities prevents players from declaring more than one conflict.
A character targetted by Spreading the Darkness can still be targetted by ring effects. Ring effects are not card abilities.
The bonus will still apply during conflicts at [Sanpuku Seidō](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/sanpuku-seido).
To be able to declare a conflict, there must be an unclaimed ring available to select.
To be able to declare a conflict, there must be an unclaimed ring available to select.
Tengu Sensei can still trigger its Reaction if the effect of Covert has been cancelled (eg. [Finger of Jade](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/finger-of-jade)), because the character was still chosen.

Abilities that cancel an ability that targets a character (eg. [Shiba Yōjimbō](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/shiba-yojimbo), [Finger of Jade](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/finger-of-jade)) cannot be used to cancel the Reaction on Tengu Sensei, as it does not choose/target the character.

Interrupt abilities trigger and resolve prior to the Triggering Condition (in this case, when the province is broken).
The character in the about to be broken province can be put into play, using Appealing to the Fortunes, before the attacking players gets to discard the card in the province (as part of breaking the province).

The ability on Kabuki Hero can only be triggered during a conflict.

*A lasting effect that expires at the end of a specified time
period can only be initiated during that time period.*

Monk characters that are played as attachments ([Tattooed Wanderer](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/tattooed-wanderer), [Togashi Kazue](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/togashi-kazue)) are no longer characters, and cannot be bowed as part of the cost of High Kick.
"Look at" is not the same as "reveal", so a province's "When revealed..." ability can no be triggered.

If you have no fate, and pass first in the dynasty phase, you can use the just gained fate to pay for Sneaky Shinjo.

*Always resolve a triggering condition before initiating any reactions to that triggering condition.*

Young Harrier prevents your affected Crane characters from having their status changed by anything that dishonors a character. 
"Cannot be dishonored" prevents the act of being dishonored, which is different to "Cannot become dishonored" which prevents entering the dishonored status.
If Feral Ningyo is put into play with its ability, and leaves play before the end of the conflict, it will not be shuffled into your conflict deck.

Void Fist can target a character that has a dash (-) for a military  skill.

*If a character has a dash for a skill value and a card ability
requires a numerical value for that skill, treat the card as if it
had an unmodifiable skill value of 0.*
A card can have multiple instances of the same keyword, but functions as if it has one instance of that keyword.

If your honor bid is higher during the Draw Phase, you cannot play Duty if it was among the cards you draw. The honor loss, as part of the honor transfer, occurs in Step 2.4, and cards are drawn in Step 2.5

If Duty is in the bottom X cards of your Conflict deck, and you draw X+1 cards, you cannot use Duty to cancel the honor loss for reshuffling your deck after running out of cards. 
All X cards are drawn simultaneously, and the shuffling of your discard pile will occur before you finish drawing those cards.

You can include 3 copies of Akodo Toturi (Core Set), or 3 copies of Akodo Toturi (Children of the Empire), or any combination of each, so long as you include no more than 3 copies in total.

*No more than 3 copies of a single card by title can be included in any combination in a player's dynasty and conflict decks.*

If you are about to resolve the Water ring effect, you cannot trigger multiple Restored Heirlooms. Once the first one resolves, the triggering condition has changed, and no further triggers would be legal.

*If an interrupt to a triggering condition that would occur changes the nature of that which is about to occur, no further interrupts to the original triggering condition may be used, as that triggering condition is no longer imminent.*

A character chosen by Clarity of Purpose can be bowed by cards that resolve ring effects ([Guardian Kami](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/guardian-kami), [Kami Unleashed](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/kami-unleashed)) (selecting the Water ring effect to resolve). It is a ring effect that is bowing the character, and not a card effect.

Declaring the type and element of the conflict, the attacked province, attacking characters, and covert targets, are all considered to be performed simultaneously, and they all share the same reaction window.

Guest of Honor will prevent an opponent from playing Reactions to a conflict being declared ([Mantra of Fire](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/mantra-of-fire) etc.), if she is already attacking, thus participating.

source: RRG "2.3 or D4 Reveal honor dials"
text:
Akodo Kage changes the actual dial (note that he doesn’t refer to “the value of the bid” like [Contingency Plan](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/contingency-plan)). 

When resolving dial reveals, you reference the bid on your dial and then apply modifiers to the value.

If an event card played via Togashi Mitsu has its effects cancelled, it is not put on the bottom of the conflict deck, as its effects did not resolve. The card remains in the discard pile, as the top (most recently played) card.

You are not limited to naming a card that you see in the opponent's hand.

The card you name cannot be played, whether from hand (even if drawn later in the phase), discard pile ([Togashi Mitsu](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/togashi-mitsu), [Guidance of the Ancestors](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/guidance-of-the-ancestors) etc.), provinces ([Hidden Moon Dojo](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/hidden-moon-dojo) etc.), or top of the deck ([Artisan Academy](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/artisan-academy) etc.).
