You cannot trigger the Reaction on Ignoble Enforcers when you put them into play by card effects. You can only do that when you play them. ('Play' and 'Put into play' are different things.)

Kitsuki Shomon cannot trigger her ability to ready if she is already dishonored. 

She is not able to redirect the dishonor to herself, as it is not a valid game state change, and thus the pre-Then text will not be fulfilled.

Utaku Tetsuko increases the cost of opponent's cards that are played "as if it were in your hand" ([Artisan Academy](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/artisan-academy), [Hidden Moon Dojo](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/hidden-moon-dojo), etc).

Pragmatism prevents the attached character from having their status changed by anything that honors or dishonors a character. "Cannot be dis/honored" prevents the act of being dis/honored, which is different to "Cannot become dis/honored" which prevents entering the dis/honored status.

Marauding Oni cannot have its status changed by anything that honors or dishonors a character. "Cannot be dis/honored" prevents the act of being dis/honored, which is different to "Cannot become dis/honored" which prevents entering the dis/honored status.
You do not need to pay for the attachment that Agasha Shunsen searches for. It is considered to be put into play, rather than played.

Because the attachment is being put into play, any play requirements ([Infiltrator](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/infiltrator), [Liar's Mask](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/liar-s-mask))
can be ignored.

*A card that has been put into play is not considered to have been "played."*
If one player has no cards in hand (after Offer Testimony is played), their opponent will reveal the card with the lowest cost, and will bow their character.
If both players reveal a card with the same cost, both characters will bow. ('Each player' indicates multiple players can be affected)

After being played, the card will not remain removed from the game.
It will go to its owner's discard pile (event), or be in play (attachment).

You cannot trigger an ability on a card if the ability puts the card into play from hand ([Feral Ningyo](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/feral-ningyo), [Vengeful Oathkeeper](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/vengeful-oathkeeper)], etc.), since the card is not in your hand.
Each bonus can only be applied once, even if the ring is both claimed and contested (via [Secluded Shrine](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/secluded-shrine)).
My Ancestor's Strength can set the Shugenja's skill to a dash (–), but it cannot set a dash to another value.
Skills that have been set cannot be switched ([Along the River of Gold](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/along-the-river-of-gold), [Bayushi Yunako](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/bayushi-yunako)).
If Kaito Temple Protector targets a character with a dash (–) for a skill value, its own corresponding current skill value is set to a dash (not 0).
Skills that have been set cannot be switched ([Along the River of Gold](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/along-the-river-of-gold), [Bayushi Yunako](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/bayushi-yunako)).
Skills that have been set cannot be switched ([Along the River of Gold](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/along-the-river-of-gold), [Bayushi Yunako](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/bayushi-yunako)).

The Shinobi enters play dishonored. There is no interaction with cards like [Young Rumormonger](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/young-rumormonger) or [Steward of Law](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/steward-of-law), as there is no transition from ordinary status to dishonored status.

If you are tied on honor with your opponent, you cannot play a card that requires you to be on less honor (eg. [Blackmail](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/blackmail)), interrupting with Mantis Tenkinja to lose the 1 honor to meet the play requirement.
Nezumi Infiltrator is not immune to the costs on Shadowlands cards (eg. [Tainted Hero](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/tainted-hero)).

When resolving the Void ring effect given to a non-Void ring by [Isawa Kaede](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/isawa-kaede), you cannot choose that ring's effect to resolve with All and Nothing, as it is not "another ring".

You cannot play multiple copies of All and Nothing during the same Interrupt Window when resolving the Void ring effect. Once the first All and Nothing is played and resolved, the original triggering condition has been replaced, and is no longer imminent.

Reclusive Zokujin will have its skills reduced by opponent's attachments that affect skills (eg. [Fiery Madness](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/fiery-madness)), because these are skill modifiers, and not card effects.

*A card effect is any effect that arises from the resolution of
ability text printed on or gained by a card.*

The Reaction on Mantis Seafarer can be triggered an Unlimited number of times per round, but only once per conflict.

*A reaction with a specified limit that enables it to be triggered more than once per round may only be initiated once each time its specified triggering condition occurs.*

The Reaction on Watch Commander can be triggered an Unlimited number of times per round, but only once per card played.

A reaction with a specified limit that enables it to be triggered more than once per round may only be initiated once each time its specified triggering condition occurs.

The Reaction on Doji Shigeru can be triggered an Unlimited number of times per round, but only once per event played.

*A reaction with a specified limit that enables it to be triggered more than once per round may only be initiated once each time its specified triggering condition occurs.*

The Reaction on Heartless Intimidator can be triggered an Unlimited number of times per round, but only once per honor loss.

*A reaction with a specified limit that enables it to be triggered more than once per round may only be initiated once each time its specified triggering condition occurs.*

The Reaction on Hida Amoro can be triggered an Unlimited number of times per round, but only once per pass.

*A reaction with a specified limit that enables it to be triggered more than once per round may only be initiated once each time its specified triggering condition occurs.*

The Reaction on Shiba Tetsu can be triggered an Unlimited number of times per round, but only once per Spell played.

*A reaction with a specified limit that enables it to be triggered more than once per round may only be initiated once each time its specified triggering condition occurs.*

The Reaction on Soshi Shiori can be triggered an Unlimited number of times per round, but only once per conflict.

A reaction with a specified limit that enables it to be triggered more than once per round may only be initiated once each time its specified triggering condition occurs.

The Reaction on Yasuki Oguri can be triggered an Unlimited number of times per round, but only once per event played.

*A reaction with a specified limit that enables it to be triggered more than once per round may only be initiated once each time its specified triggering condition occurs.*

The Reaction on Yasuki Taka can be triggered an Unlimited number of times per round, but only once per character leaving play.

*A reaction with a specified limit that enables it to be triggered more than once per round may only be initiated once each time its specified triggering condition occurs.*

The Reaction on Marauding Oni triggers an Unlimited number of times per round, but only once per declaration.

*A reaction with a specified limit that enables it to be triggered more than once per round may only be initiated once each time its specified triggering condition occurs.*
If the card revealed by Pillow Book is moved to another game zone and is no longer the top card of the deck, the lasting effect applying to it expires, and you can no longer play it.
Social Puppeteer does not force you to make choices to ensure it can be targetted; rather that if it can be chosen, it must be.

Two Social Puppeteers controlled by the same player does not mean that neither can be targetted by an event that targets a single character. The opponent can play the event, and must target one of the Social Puppeteers, of their choice.
Honest Challenger must participate in the duel that it initiates.
Both the Honest Challenger and the character it duels must be participating in the conflict.
The +2 Military from Composure will be added to the total skill for the duel, as skill is compared after honor bids are revealed.

Ethereal Dreamer instructs you to target a physical ring. If another ring gains the same element (via [Seeker of Knowledge](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/seeker-of-knowledge) or [Isawa Kaede](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/isawa-kaede)), Ethereal Dreamer's effect does not apply.
The additional character does not have a clan symbol, so is considered a Neutral character.

If Shosuro Sadako and [Bayushi Yojiro](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/bayushi-yojiro) are in a conflict together, Sadako’s dishonored status token will not add her glory to her skills. Because Yojiro causes the status token to be ignored, there is no skill subtraction for Sadako’s text to replace.
If you play an opponent's card using Trading on the Sand Road, you control the card until a card or game effect changes that.
If you play an opponent's card using Stolen Secrets, you control the card until a card or game effect changes that.
After being played, the card will not remain removed from the game. It will go to its owner's discard pile (event), or be in play (attachment).
The honor exchange due to honor bids during a duel is a framework step, and will not allow Shiotome Heroine to trigger her Reaction.

The Reaction on Shiro Shinjo can be triggered after you *collect* fate during framework step 1.3 of the Dynasty phase.

It cannot be triggered after you *gain* the fate for passing first in the Dynasty phase.
Broken provinces are still faceup, so will count towards Shiro Shinjo's Reaction.
Broken provinces are still faceup, so will count towards Speak to the Heart's Action.
If a character has Mirumoto Daisho attached, another restricted attachment can be played on the character, but it will immediately be discarded.

Akodo Toturi prevents players from playing cards "as if it were in your hand" ([Artisan Academy](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/artisan-academy), [Hidden Moon Dojo](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/hidden-moon-dojo), etc).

You can include 3 copies of Akodo Toturi (Core Set), or 3 copies of Akodo Toturi (Children of the Empire), or any combination of each, so long as you include no more than 3 copies in total.

*No more than 3 copies of a single card by title can be included in any combination in a player's dynasty and conflict decks.*

Normally, the **Action** to play a character attached to Back-Alley Hideaway can only be triggered during the Dynasty phase (see RRG [Character Cards](https://fiveringsdb.com/rules/reference#character-cards)).

The **Action** can be triggered during the Conflict phase to play a character using its Disguised keyword.

Taryū-Jiai does not use the new template for duels (see [Duel Timing](https://fiveringsdb.com/rules/reference#duel-timing)), so it uses its own text to determine which characters can be chosen for the duel. The text does not state that the characters need to be participating in the conflict, so one, or both, of the chosen **Shugenja** can be at home.

The characters in adjacent provinces can be played normally during the Dynasty phase, or you may (see [May](https://fiveringsdb.com/rules/reference#may)) play them as if they were characters in your hand, during any other phase.
The reaction on Spyglass can still be triggered, even if the attached character has been removed from the conflict before the controlling player's opportunity to take the reaction.
The reaction on Ancient Master can still be triggered, even if the attached character has been removed from the conflict before the controlling player's opportunity to take the reaction.
Your opponent must select an option that can change the game state (cannot choose to bow a bowed character, or remove fate from a character with no fate).

If the pre-dash sacrifice is prevented (e.g. by [Reprieve](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/reprieve)), the ability is prevented from initiating. The event remains unplayed in its owner's hand. A failed initiation attempt does not count towards Limits and Maximums. The opportunity to act is passed to the opponent.

Sacrificing a friendly character is the cost of In Defense of Rokugan. By the time the ability's effects can be cancelled, costs have already been paid, and a friendly character has already been sacrificed.
The +2 Political from Composure will be added to the total skill for the duel, as skill is compared after honor bids are revealed.
If a character “cannot receive dishonored status tokens,” then those tokens cannot be placed on or moved to that character. That character cannot be dishonored if it is ordinary.
Kyuden Bayushi can be triggered to give a ready, dishonored character +1/+1 (the bonus is not dependent on readying).

If Feral Ningyo is put into play with its ability, and then has its text blanked (eg. [Cloud the Mind](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/cloud-the-mind)), it will still be shuffled into your conflict deck at the end of the conflict.
The ability creates a delayed effect, which is not stopped by blanking the text that created it.

Regardless of which honor bid belongs to which player, the difference between the two ("X") will be a positive (absolute) value.
Therefore, Make an Opening will always apply a negative skill modifier.
You can trigger Mantis Tenkinja when playing a 0 cost event.

You can initiate Mantis Tenkinja after play restrictions have been determined (interrupting step 2).

If, after triggering Mantis Tenkinja, you cannot pay the fate cost of the event, you will lose 1 honor and then the event will fail to be played during step 2.

The action on Paragon of Grace can be triggered if it is the only character participating on its side of the conflict.
It does not need to be the only character participating in the conflict (ie. unopposed).

When Shinjo Ambusher triggers its ability, it applies a lasting effect to the province currently being attacked.
If the conflict moves to another province (eg. [Talisman of the Sun](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/talisman-of-the-sun)), the new province being attacked can trigger its abilities.

If Fawning Diplomat has a [Cloud the Mind](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/cloud-the-mind]) attached, you will not claim the Imperial Favor when it leaves play.

The Interrupt on Fawning Diplomat is triggered before the character leaves play, but the Cloud the Mind is discarded as the character leaves play.

Hantei XXXVIII cannot trigger his Interrupt if the opponent's triggered ability does not use the word *choose* in its text. Any decisions that do not use the word *choose* are not affected by Hantei XXXVIII.

Both your character, and the character your opponent controls and chooses, must be participating in the conflict.

*If a duel is initiated during a conflict, both characters chosen must be participating.*
You cannot trigger the Reaction on Aranat when you put it into play by card effects. You can only do that when you play it. ('Play' and 'Put into play' are different things.)
You cannot trigger the Reaction on Shinjo Ambusher when you put it into play by card effects. You can only do that when you play it. ('Play' and 'Put into play' are different things.)
You cannot trigger the Reaction on Meek Informant when you put it into play by card effects. You can only do that when you play it. ('Play' and 'Put into play' are different things.)

You cannot trigger the Reaction on Asahina Takamori when you put a Crane character into play by card effects. You can only do that when you play a Crane character. ('Play' and 'Put into play' are different things.)

Kirei-ko triggers after the ability triggers ([step 8](https://fiveringsdb.com/rules/reference#initiating-abilities-playing-cards)), which is after effects have fully resolved. It can still trigger even if the effects of the ability are canceled.
Kirei-ko does not target (does not say "choose"), so it cannot be cancelled by [Finger of Jade](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/finger-of-jade).
Characters only trigger their own abilities. Abilities on attachments are triggered by players, not by characters.

Hantei XXXVIII can only interrupt Triggered Abilities (**Action:**, **Interrupt:**, **Reaction:**).

He cannot interrupt Keywords (Covert, etc), or Ring Effects.
If two or more cards are tied for the highest printed cost, the player who triggered Midnight Revels can choose which one to effect.
If the highest cost character in play is already bowed, you cannot trigger the Reaction on Midnight Revels.

Ide Negotiator's reaction changes the physical honor dial.

*If a card ability references a player's honor bid, the ability is referencing the current setting on the player's honor dial.*

Kiku Matsuri can only be triggered if each player who controls a participating character controls at least one eligible target (participating characters that can each be honored; eligibility is assessed individually).

Utaku Kamoko can trigger her reaction to ready herself while honored, or to honor herself while ready (the two effects are independent).

The reaction cannot be triggered if Utaku Kamoko is both ready and honored.

*A triggered ability can only be initiated if its effect has the potential to change the game state on its own. This potential is assessed without taking into account the consequences of the cost payment or the consequences of any other ability interactions.*
Effects that modify the value of the honor bid only affect the current bid, the setting on the dial is not physically adjusted.

You can attach Honed Nodachi to an opponent's character, but you cannot remove a fate from the attached character to trigger its Reaction.

*When a player is paying a cost, the payment must be made with cards and/or game elements that player controls. The word "friendly" is used as a reminder of this in some costs.*

Kirei-ko can only react to Triggered Abilities (**Action:**, **Interrupt:**, **Reaction:**).

It cannot react to Keywords (Covert, Pride etc), or Ring Effects.

Way of the Dragon does not use the word *printed*, so abilities gained from other cards (eg. [Duelist Training](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/duelist-training)) can also be triggered an additional time.

If Callow Delegate has a [Cloud the Mind](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/cloud-the-mind]) attached, you will not be able to honor a character when it leaves play.

The Interrupt on Callow Delegate is triggered before the character leaves play, but the Cloud the Mind is discarded as the character leaves play.

The Interrupt on Appealing to the Fortunes puts a character into play, rather than playing it.

As such, you do not have to pay fate for the character, and you cannot add additional fate to the character. This is the same whether the character comes from a province or your hand.

From the Shadows puts a character into play, rather than playing it.

As such, you do not have to pay fate for the character, and you cannot add additional fate to the character. This is the same whether the character comes from a province or your hand.

Ikoma Eiji puts a character into play, rather than playing it.

As such, you do not have to pay fate for the character, and you cannot add additional fate to the character. This is the same whether the character comes from a province or your discard pile.
Clarity of Purpose can be played during a Military conflict, as the first effect (*opponents' card effects cannot bow this character*) is not dependent on it being a Political conflict.
"Cannot be discarded" does not prevent Student of War from being sacrificed for [Way of the Crab](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/way-of-the-crab). 'Discard' and 'sacrifice' are different game terms.

If your Duelist wins a duel against multiple opponents (eg. [Mirumoto Hitomi](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/mirumoto-hitomi)), you choose one of the losing characters to be affected by Insult to Injury.

Kamayari can only react to Triggered Abilities (**Action:**, **Interrupt:**, **Reaction:**).

It cannot react to Keywords (Covert, Pride etc), or Ring Effects.
If Cloud the Mind is attached to a character that has already triggered its ability, the effects of that ability are not blanked/negated.

The Action on Raise the Alarm puts a character into play, rather than playing it.

As such, you do not have to pay fate for the character, and you cannot add additional fate to the character.
Raise the Alarm cannot be used to put a character with a dash (-) Military skill into the conflict.
Shiotome Heroine can only trigger her reaction if the honor gain is the result of a card effect, and not from a card's cost (eg. [Smuggling Deal](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/smuggling-deal)).

Being removed from the game is a form of leaving play. Therefore, cards that prevent a character leaving play (eg. [Reprieve](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/reprieve), [Stand Your Ground](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/stand-our-ground)) can be used to prevent Isawa Ujina from removing the character from play.

Severed From the Stream can be played if neither player has rings in their claimed pool, or if the glory count would be tied.

Having a glory count is a change in game state.
A non-physical ring (eg [Secluded Shrine](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/secluded-shrine)) cannot be *returned* to the unclaimed ring pool, as it never came from there in the first place.
The ability of Honest Challenger does not use the word **may**, so it is mandatory for controller of the duel's winner to move a character into the conflict.
You cannot trigger the Reaction on Hiruma Skirmisher when you put it into play by card effects. You can only do that when you play it. ('Play' and 'Put into play' are different things.)

Although you control all of the cards in each of your decks, Katana of Fire only gets a skill bonus for **Fire** cards in play.

*Card abilities only interact with, and can only target, cards that are in play, unless the ability specifically refers to an out-of-play area or element.*
Discarding the top 3 cards of the conflict deck is a cost. If there are 2 or less cards in the conflict deck, the character cannot ready.

If a skill value was increased during a conflict at another province, and the conflict was subsequently moved to this province (eg. [Talisman of the Sun](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/talisman-of-the-sun)), the previous skill increases would be ignored while the conflict is at Festival of the Departed.
Festival of the Departed does not prevent skill values from being modified by “set” effects.

Tactician's Apprentice can only trigger his reaction when multiple dials are revealed, and not when only a single dial is revealed (eg. [Maze of Illusion](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/maze-of-illusion)).
"..1 or more other characters you control..." refers to the controller of the attachment, regardless of who controls the character it is attached to.

Way of the Dragon increases the limit of the number of times an ability can be triggered. If a character triggers an ability the maximum allowed times, and Way of the Dragon subsequently leaves play (eg. [Let Go](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/let-go)), the limit will drop back to its printed amount. Attaching a new Way of the Dragon will again increase the limit, but will not allow an additional trigger of the ability, since the limit was previously reached.
Moto Chagatai only ignores the framework bow that occurs during step 3.2.8 Return Home.
"...cannot lose fate..." means that fate cannot be removed from Student of War, by any means.
Shosuro Hyobu can trigger her reaction any time a card is discarded by her opponent due to a cost or effect, regardless of who initiated the card ability.
Breakthrough does not force your opponent to pass their opportunity to declare a conflict. It simply changes the order of how conflicts are declared (from the regular alternating between players).

Your opponent must select an option that can change the game state (cannot choose to give you an honor if they are unable to lose honor (eg. [Righteous Magistrate](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/righteous-magistrate))).

Declaring a conflict with Isawa Kaede always counts as declaring a Void conflict (as well as whatever the element of the physical ring). She adds the element whenever she is participating, which also includes when she is declared as an attacker.

Therefore, if your opponent plays [Way of the Phoenix](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/way-of-the-phoenix), choosing the Void Ring, Isawa Kaede cannot be declared as an attacker that phase.

If a second Mirumoto Daishō is attached to a character, the text on both attachments ( ...character may not have other restricted attachments...) will apply simultaneously, and both Daishōs will be discarded.

Mirumoto Daishō only affects the number your opponent can select on their dial during the initial honor bid (step D.3) . 

Card abilities that alter the value on the dial (eg. [Contingency Plan](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/contingency-plan)), 
or change the bid on the dial (eg. [Ide Negotiator](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/ide-negotiator)) can still be triggered to change the final result.

The Reaction on Hida Tsuru can be triggered an Unlimited number of times per round, but only once per character that moves.

A reaction with a specified limit that enables it to be triggered more than once per round may only be initiated once each time its specified triggering condition occurs.
If a card ability allows multiple characters to move (eg. [Wild Stallion](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/wild-stallion)), Hida Tsuru can react once for each character that moves.

Turning a province facedown effectively makes it leave play. Thus, any abilities on that province can be used again (limits are reset), and lasting effects affecting that province expire (e.g. [Ride Them Down](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/ride-them-down), [Disdainful Remark](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/disdainful-remark)), and any tokens on that province are discarded (e.g. [Public Forum](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/public-forum)).

The Reaction on Ikebana Artisan can be triggered an Unlimited number of times per round, but only once per conflict.

*A reaction with a specified limit that enables it to be triggered more than once per round may only be initiated once each time its specified triggering condition occurs.*

The Reaction on Isawa Ujina can be triggered an Unlimited number of times per round, but only once per claiming of the Void ring.

*A reaction with a specified limit that enables it to be triggered more than once per round may only be initiated once each time its specified triggering condition occurs.*

The Reaction on Winter Court Hosts can be triggered an Unlimited number of times per round, but only once per card played.

*A reaction with a specified limit that enables it to be triggered more than once per round may only be initiated once each time its specified triggering condition occurs.*
The card is named in Step 7, after the opportunity to play cancels has passed (Step 6)

If Young Warrior cannot be declared as an attacker (eg. [Asahina Takamori](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/asahina-takamori)), or as a defender (eg. due to Covert), her text has no effect. 

"Cannot" overrides "must".

If Young Warrior's controller is first player, and Young Warrior cannot participate in a particular type of conflict (eg. [Pacifism](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/pacifism) or [Stolen Breath](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/stolen-breath)), if the player declares an attack, it must be of the type that Young Warrior can participate in, and Young Warrior must be declared.

You can only play the cards removed from game due to the just played copy of Trading on the Sand Road. 

The text "...the removed cards..." refers to these cards, and not to cards removed from the game by other effects.

Only one copy of Trading on the Sand Road can be played each round.
The first copy replaces the draw phase, so a second copy would have nothing to replace.

If the attacking player only controls a ready character that has a restriction on which ring it can declared to attack with (eg. [Fire Tensai Acolyte](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/fire-tensai-acolyte)), the defending player must select the appropriate ring to make the attack valid.
Warriors of the Wind can be played to move ***Cavalry*** characters to the conflict if you do not control any participating ***Cavalry*** characters to move home first.
Warriors of the Wind can be played just to move your participating ***Cavalry*** characters home, by choosing zero characters to move to the conflict.

City of the Open Hand received official errata. 

Its ability now instructs you to either gain 1 honor, or force your opponent to lose 1 honor.
Prudent Challenger can initiate its duel, even if neither participant has an attachment attached to them.
Aspiring Challenger can initiate its duel, even if both participants are already honored.
Honest Challenger can initiate its duel, even if neither player controls a character in their home.
Mirumoto Dōjō can initiate its duel, even if neither participant has a fate on them.

Watch Commander can still trigger even if the effects of an event have been canceled (eg. [Voice of Honor](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/voice-of-honor)), since the event has still been played.

*If the effects of an event card are canceled, the card is still considered to have been played, and it is still placed in its owner's discard pile.*
While Righteous Magistrate is defending, players are prevented from playing cards that include honor loss as part of their cost (eg. [Assassination](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/assassination)).

If Daimyō's Gunbai's ability is canceled by [Hida Kisada](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/hida-kisada), you can use it again.

Cards in hidden game areas (e.g. in hand) have no card memory, so Limits do not apply to them.

When you trigger Illustrious Forge, you are not forced to put an attachment into play.

*A player is not obliged to find the object of a search effect, even if the searched cards contain a card that meets the eligibility requirements of the search.*

Subdue the Spirits applies a lasting effect (that applies “add glory to skills”) to each of your characters currently participating in the conflict. Rather than add each character's current glory, any changes to the glory values will be reflected in the skill totals for resolution
Subdue the Spirits cannot be played if participating characters cannot have their skills increased (eg [Festival of the Departed](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/festival-of-the-departed)).
Playing multiple copies of Subdue the Spirits in the same conflict will add each character's glory for each copy played.

All and Nothing can allow you to resolve a particular ring effect twice, if the contested ring has had multiple other elements added to it.  
The chosen ring effect must be one of the ones given to the contested ring, and not the contested ring's effect.

Utaku Kamoko can trigger her reaction when her controller triggers their own Endless Plains to destroy the province.

*If a province breaks for any reason other than through standard conflict resolution, the opponent of the player who controls that province is considered to have broken the province.*

Warm Welcome cannot be used to play events with a reaction/interrupt ability (eg. [Display of Power](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/display-of-power)).  
But it can choose such a card, to put it on the bottom of your conflict deck, since doing this is not dependent on the card being played.
Pilgrimage cancels ring effects before they can be interrupted (eg. [Restored Heirloom](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/restored-heirloom), [Asako Azunami](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/asako-azunami)).
When you duel with True Strike Kenjutsu, the value of your bid is added to base skill .

If a participating character’s skill values are dependent upon players’ honor bids, Kakita Toshimoko’s interrupt ability can alter the calculation of skill totals in step [3.2.3](https://fiveringsdb.com/rules/reference#3-2-3-compare-skill-values-and-determine-result) before fully resolving that step by changing those players’ bids and potentially changing which player wins or loses the conflict due to the change in skill values.

- Because interrupts resolve before their triggering condition (page 11), and because “[would](https://fiveringsdb.com/rules/reference#would)” effects have the capability to change the triggering condition, Toshimoko’s ability has the potential to change the outcome of step 3.2.3. Therefore, if: a character’s skill values are dependent upon the players’ honor bids, Toshimoko’s duel changes those bids, and he loses the duel, then it is possible that Toshimoko could lose the duel but win the conflict (if up against a [Sincere Challenger](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/sincere-challenger) who loses composure in a political conflict, for example, or by being honored by [Kyūden Kakita](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/kyuden-kakita)). It is also possible that recalculating skill values for step 3.2.3 due to Toshimoko’s ability could cause a province that would originally be breaking to no longer be breaking if the loss of skill (or increase of Toshimoko’s skill) causes the attacking player to not have the excess skill necessary to cause the province to break.

The italicized text on Unveiled Destiny is reminder text for how to resolve multiple-element-rings. The attacking player will still choose which elemental ring effect to resolve, not the controller of Unveiled Destiny.
The honor loss occurs simultaneously with step 8, at which the ability is considered to have been triggered.

Effects resolve simultaneously, so if Prayers to Ebisu would draw a card from an empty conflict deck, you would reshuffle and lose 5 honor before either of the effects (gain 4 honor or draw 1 card) would resolve.

The two characters are played in sequence. You do not have to decide on the second character until you have played the first. Reactions can be triggered after each card is played.

The two provinces are refilled immediately after playing each card, so you can turn one of the refilled cards faceup with the post-Then effect.
Disguised Protector will use the dials as they are during conflict resolution, not when the ability is triggered.﻿

Cards that look for whether a character enters play from a province (eg. [Toshi Ranbo](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/toshi-ranbo)) will be able to trigger if the character is played from under Back-Alley Hideaway.

*When a card is played “as if it were in” another zone, card effects that interact with the card being played only see that other zone, not the one it actually came from.*

Toshi Ranbo counts as a province of all five elements at all
times and can be selected during deck construction to fulfill
the province slot of any element.
If the dishonor for refusing Duel to the Death is replaced (eg. [Young Rumormonger](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/young-rumormonger)), the refusal is still successful.

Khan's Ordu only affects conflict declarations. Card abilities that switch conflict type (eg. [Rally to the Cause](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/rally-to-the-cause), [Kuroi Mori](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/kuroi-mori)) can still switch the conflict to Political.

If the duel created by Daimyō's Gunbai is canceled (eg. [Stay Your Hand](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/stay-your-hand)), the Gunbai will be discarded, as there is no winner of the duel to attach it to.
Daimyō's Gunbai cannot by played from the discard pile using [Warm Welcome](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/warm-welcome).
Daimyō's Gunbai can only be played using it's triggered ability, but it can be put into play by other card effects (eg. [Illustrious Forge](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/illustrious-forge)).
Agasha Shunsen can put into play an attachment with a dash cost (eg. [Daimyō's Gunbai](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/daimyo-s-gunbai)).

If two characters involved in the duel on the same side (eg. opposing [Mirumoto Hitomi](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/mirumoto-hitomi)) and they win, Proving Ground can be triggered twice, once for each winning participant.
If you play Feral Ningyo (rather than use its Action to put it into play), you can trigger Feral Ningyo while it is in play to shuffle it back into your deck at the end of the Water conflict.

Ivory Kingdoms Unicorn is triggered after participants of the first conflict go home bowed, and a new conflict starts immediately. There is no action window between conflicts in which you could ready a character in time for it to be declared as an attacker (e.g. [Border Rider](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/border-rider), [I Am Ready](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/i-am-ready)).
Ivory Kingdoms Unicorn can only trigger its reaction if it was present throughout the entire resolution of the conflict.
Bayushi Dairu cannot choose a status token to move if he already has that status token.
If Bayushi Dairu chooses and moves an honor status token while he has a dishonored status token (or vice versa), both tokens will be discarded, and he will return to ordinary status.

If Bayushi Dairu is in the same conflict as a character that prevents characters from receiving status tokens (eg. [Steward of the Rich Frog](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/steward-of-the-rich-frog)) or becoming honored/dishonored (eg. [Steward of Law](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/steward-of-law)), he cannot move the relevant status token to himself.

If you own and control a copy of Daimyō's Gunbai in play, you can trigger the Action on a second copy in your hand, to initiate the duel.
If your character wins this duel, it cannot attach the second copy.

*A player cannot take control of or bring into play a unique card if he or she already controls or owns another in-play card with the same title or printed title.*

If a copy of Daimyō's Gunbai that your opponent owns and controls is attached to one of your characters, you can trigger the Action on a copy in your hand, to initiate the duel. If your character wins this duel, it is able to attach the second copy.

*A player cannot take control of or bring into play a unique card if he or she already controls or owns another in-play card with the same title or printed title.*
An honored character can be chosen as the target of Purity of Spirit. It will not be honored, but the lasting effect will discard the honor status token at the end of the conflict.

The Pride keyword adds a status token after step [3.2.3](https://fiveringsdb.com/rules/reference#3-2-3-compare-skill-values-and-determine-result).

The Fire Ring adds a status token in step [3.2.6](https://fiveringsdb.com/rules/reference#3-2-6-resolve-ring-effects).

A status token gained via either of these methods will be removed by Purity of Spirit at step [3.3](https://fiveringsdb.com/rules/reference#3-3-conflict-ends-conflict-was-passed), the end of the conflict.
Fight On can be used to ready a bowed character that is already participating in the conflict (moving is not dependent on readying).

Hiruma Signaller can be used to ready a bowed character that is already participating in the conflict, or to move a ready character to the conflict. (readying is not dependent on moving, and vice versa)
Secluded Shrine's ring generally does not have an associated type (MIL/POL), but will gain the appropriate type if your opponent claims that ring.
While Righteous Magistrate is defending, players do not transfer honor during duels, regardless of what honor bid they reveal. This will not affect the outcome of the duel.

Shinjo Ambusher prevents **Action:**, **Reaction:**, and **Interrupt:** abilities from being triggered. Constant abilities (eg. [Pilgrimage](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/pilgrimage)) are not affected.
If the effects of an ability are canceled, the ability is still considered to have been used, and any costs have still been paid.

Ivory Kingdoms Unicorn only affects conflict declarations. Card abilities that switch conflict type (eg. [Rally to the Cause](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/rally-to-the-cause), [Kuroi Mori](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/kuroi-mori)) can still switch the conflict to Political.
Greater Understanding can be triggered by cards that *move* fate to the ring (eg. [Jade Masterpiece](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/jade-masterpiece)).

Stay Your Hand cancels the duel in step [D.1. Initiate a Duel](https://fiveringsdb.com/rules/reference#d-1-initiate-a-duel), before Honor Dials are used ([step D.3.](https://fiveringsdb.com/rules/reference#d-3-duel-honor-bid)).
Ide Ryōma can choose 2 ready characters, but not 2 bowed characters.

The delayed effect of honoring the **Bushi** resolves immediately when the conflict winner is determined ([step 3.2.3](https://fiveringsdb.com/rules/reference#3-2-3-compare-skill-values-and-determine-result)), before any Reactions to winning the conflict can be used.
Hiruma Yoshino cannot choose a character with a zero or dash military skill.

source: RRG "In Play and Out of Play"
text: If the character chosen by Hiruma Yoshino leaves the province and enters play (eg. [Charge!](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/charge)), the discard pile (eg. [Sabotage](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/sabotage)), or the dynasty deck (eg. [Peasant's Advice](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/peasant-s-advice)), the lasting effect expires, and the character no longer contributes its skill.

If the character chosen by Hiruma Yoshino is moved from its current province to another of your provinces (eg. [Asahina Takako](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/asahina-takako)), it will continue to contribute its military skill.
During a conflict at [Sanpuku Seidō](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/sanpuku-seido), the character chosen by Hiruma Yoshino will count its printed glory instead of its military skill.
If the conflict type is switched to political (eg. [Kuroi Mori](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/kuroi-mori)), the chosen character will still count its printed military skill.
The number of cards drawn is equal to the difference between your opponent's honor bid, and your new honor bid of 1.

If a second delayed effect occurs at the end of the conflict (eg. [Forebearer's Echoes](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/forebearer-s-echoes)), and it also causes a character to leave play, the first player will decide which resolves first. The second will not resolve, as the card has already left play.

If a second delayed effect occurs at the end of the conflict (eg. [Inferno Guard Invoker](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/inferno-guard-invoker)), and it also causes a character to leave play, the first player will decide which resolves first. The second will not resolve, as the card has already left play.

You can include 3 copies of Isawa Tadaka (Disciples of the Void), or 3 copies of Isawa Tadaka (Bonds of Blood), or any combination of each, so long as you include no more than 3 copies in total.

*No more than 3 copies of a single card by title can be included in any combination in a player's dynasty and conflict decks.*

You can include 3 copies of Isawa Tadaka (Disciples of the Void), or 3 copies of Isawa Tadaka (Bonds of Blood), or any combination of each, so long as you include no more than 3 copies in total.

*No more than 3 copies of a single card by title can be included in any combination in a player's dynasty and conflict decks.*

This copy of Isawa Tadaka is **not** considered to be on the Restricted List.
Cards on the Restricted List are identified by Title, Set, Card Number.

*Isawa Tadaka (Disciples of the Void, 10)*
Embrace the Void can be triggered when the attached non-unique character is chosen to be discarded for the Disguised keyword.
A character will only get the additional fate when played from Toshi Ranbo, and not when put into play (eg. [Charge!](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/charge)).
Akodo Kaede will not get discarded in the Fate Phase if she removes her last fate due to triggering her interrupt to save another character.
You cannot discard more cards than there are valid targets (characters that can be dishonored).

If your opponent's action results in additional actions (eg. [Hawk Tattoo](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/hawk-tattoo)), or the playing of multiple cards (eg. [Invoke the Divine](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/invoke-the-divine)), those actions (or those cards) are fully resolved/played before the conflict resolves.

source: RRG "3.2.3. Compare skill values and determine result"
text: False Loyalties will not change the result of the conflict. It is played as a reaction to [step 3.2.3](https://fiveringsdb.com/rules/reference#3-2-3-compare-skill-values-and-determine-result), which is the conflict resolution step where each player's total skill is determined.

If False Loyalties moves [Isawa Kaede](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/isawa-kaede) out of the conflict, the ring will immediately lose the Void element given to it by Kaede. However Kaede's delayed “if this character wins the conflict as an attacker” part of the effect will still resolve, so if the conflict gained an element through another means (eg. [Seeker of Knowledge](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/seeker-of-knowledge)) the Phoenix player will still be able to resolve multiple elements even if none of those elements are Kaede’s Void.

If False Loyalties moves [Ivory Kingdoms Unicorn](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/ivory-kingdoms-unicorn) out of the conflict, it was not attacking when the conflict finished resolving and thus its ability cannot be triggered.

When a character on Toshi Ranbo is played “as if it were in” another zone (eg. [Hidden Moon Dōjō](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/hidden-moon-dojo)), the character will not gain the additional fate from Toshi Ranbo. ﻿﻿﻿﻿
Kakita Dōjō prevents **Action:**, **Reaction:**, and **Interrupt:** abilities from being triggered. Constant abilities and keywords are not affected.

When a character with both Unmatched Expertise and Pride loses a conflict, the Pride keyword is resolved first.

The character will not become dishonored, and then the Unmatched Expertise will be discarded due to its Forced Reaction.

The character chosen by Hiruma Yoshino is not participating in the conflict, it is contributing its skill.

*A player must count at least 1 total skill and there must be at least one participating character on his or her side in order to win a conflict.*

You can include 3 copies of Doji Hotaru (Core Set), or 3 copies of Doji Hotaru (Justice for Satsume), or any combination of each, so long as you include no more than 3 copies in total.

*No more than 3 copies of a single card by title can be included in any combination in a player's dynasty and conflict decks.*

You can include 3 copies of Doji Hotaru (Core Set), or 3 copies of Doji Hotaru (Justice for Satsume), or any combination of each, so long as you include no more than 3 copies in total.

*No more than 3 copies of a single card by title can be included in any combination in a player's dynasty and conflict decks.*
Festival of the Departed prevents all skill increases, whether they are to total skill or base skill (eg. [Way of the Lion](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/way-of-the-lion)).

Festival of the Departed does not prevent you playing events that honor a character (eg. [Court Games](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/court-games)). The skill increase does not come from the event, but from the honor status token.

When an event card is played, it is considered to still be in its owner’s hand while determining whether a card’s play restrictions are met. Command Respect cannot be played if both players have the same number of cards in hand.

You can include 3 copies of Bayushi Shoju (Core Set), or 3 copies of Bayushi Shoju (Shoju's Duty), or any combination of each, so long as you include no more than 3 copies in total.

*No more than 3 copies of a single card by title can be included in any combination in a player's dynasty and conflict decks.*

You can include 3 copies of Bayushi Shoju (Core Set), or 3 copies of Bayushi Shoju (Shoju's Duty), or any combination of each, so long as you include no more than 3 copies in total.

*No more than 3 copies of a single card by title can be included in any combination in a player's dynasty and conflict decks.*
If both players are on one honor when Bayushi Shoju's Forced Reaction triggers, the first player will win the game.
Isawa Heiko cannot switch base skills on a character that has a dash (–) for a skill (dash values cannot be modified or changed).
When played during a conflict, Erudite Prestige can trigger its reaction to itself entering play.
Kitsuki Jusai can only trigger his reaction when multiple dials are revealed, and not when only a single dial is revealed (eg. [Maze of Illusion](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/maze-of-illusion)).

Kitsuki Yuikimi is considered to be participating in the conflict as soon as she is declared as an attacker. Therefore, she can trigger her reaction when fate is gained from the ring becoming contested during conflict declaration.

Trusted Advisor is considered to be participating in the conflict as soon as she is declared as an attacker. Therefore, she can trigger her reaction when fate is gained from the ring becoming contested during conflict declaration.
The sharing of clan affiliation with your opponent's participating character refers to both events and attachments.
Akodo Kaede’s effect can prevent a character from being sacrificed.
After Voice of the Ancestors plays a **Spirit** attachment on a character, if that character already has a **Spirit** character, you must discard the first **Spirit** (the one not just played).

Display of Power cannot be played by the attacking player.

*A conflict is unopposed if the attacking player wins the conflict and the defending player controls no participating characters at the time the conflict winner is determined.*

A second Watch Commander can be attached to a character.
The "Limit 1 per character" would then mean the first Watch Commander is discarded.

A second Way of the Dragon can be attached to a character.
The "Limit 1 per character" would then mean the first Way of the Dragon is discarded.
A second Adopted Kin can be attached to a character. The "Limit 1 per character" would then mean the first Adopted Kin is discarded.

A second ***Battlefield*** attachment can be attached to a province. The "Limit 1 ***Battlefield*** attachment per province" would then mean all other ***Battlefield*** attachments attached to that province are discarded.

source: RRG "3.2.3. Compare skill values and determine result"
text:
Total Warfare will trigger during the resolution of the conflict in which the attached province is broken.

Step 3.2.3 is where the player loses the conflict, and reactions to losing trigger here, before the province is broken in step 3.2.5.
Savvy Politician’s ability does not trigger if an honored status token is moved to it by a card ability. It only triggers if an effect “honors” it.
Young Rumormonger’s ability does not trigger if an honored or dishonored status token is moved to a character by a card ability. It only triggers if an effect “honors” or “dishonors” a character.

Reprieve’s effect can prevent a character from being sacrificed.

If that occurs during the payment of a cost, then that cost is not considered to have been paid as the sacrifice was prevented. If the sacrifice while paying an event’s cost is prevented, the effects do not initiate and that event remains unplayed in its owner’s hand.

If that occurs during the resolution of an effect, then nothing is dependent upon whether or not the sacrifice resolved successfully. In the same way that an event whose effects were canceled by [Voice of Honor](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/voice-of-honor) is still considered to have been played, a card like [Way of the Crab](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/way-of-the-crab) is still considered to have been played even if its effects are prevented by Reprieve.

If Above Question is played on an opponent’s character, that opponent cannot choose the attached character as a target for their own events.

If the attached character is the only participating character controlled by that opponent, [Court Games](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/court-games)’s honoring effect cannot be selected, as the attached character cannot be chosen as a target.

The ring chosen for Secluded Shrine’s effect can be in multiple states at once. For example, while unclaimed, the chosen ring simultaneously counts as being in both the unclaimed ring pool and in your claimed ring pool.

- You cannot move the chosen ring out of your claimed ring pool due to the cost or effect of a card ability unless the physical ring token is in your claimed ring pool.

The province that is chosen by Agasha Taiko’s ability cannot be declared as the attacked province and the conflict cannot be moved to it.

- If Agasha Taiko is played during a conflict and chooses the currently attacked province for her ability, the conflict immediately ends with no winner and all participating characters are moved home bowed.
If a character “cannot receive dishonored status tokens,” then those tokens cannot be placed on or moved to that character. That character cannot be dishonored if it is ordinary.

Master of Keepsakes cannot prevent a character from going from honored to ordinary. The honored character does not receive a dishonored status token when it is dishonored.

*When an honored character is dishonored, it loses its
honored status, discards the status token, and returns to
ordinary status.*
If Waning Hostilities was played this phase, [Breakthrough](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/breakthrough) cannot be played.

Waning Hostilities does not make players pass the second conflict opportunity, so [Intimidating Hida](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/intimidating-hida) and [Hida Amoro](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/hida-amoro) do not trigger.

Unmatched Expertise cannot prevent the attached character from going from honored to ordinary. An honored character does not receive a dishonored status token when it is dishonored.

*When an honored character is dishonored, it loses its
honored status, discards the status token, and returns to
ordinary status.*

When an event card is played, it is considered to still be in its owner’s hand until after all costs and selections have been made.

- While choosing targets during Step 5 of the process of playing [For Shame](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/for-shame) on a Steward of the Rich Frog, the Steward’s text prevents characters from receiving dishonored status tokens. Because selecting options happens during the same step as choosing targets, the For Shame is still in the opponent’s hand when the selection is made, and an option whose effect would fail to change the game state cannot be selected.

If a character “cannot receive dishonored status tokens,” then those tokens cannot be placed on or moved to that character. That character cannot be dishonored if it is ordinary.

Steward of the Rich Frog cannot prevent a character from going from honored to ordinary. The honored character does not receive a dishonored status token when it is dishonored.

*When an honored character is dishonored, it loses its
honored status, discards the status token, and returns to
ordinary status.*
Keeper of Secret Names can only resolve an **Action:** ability, not a Reaction or Interrupt.

Resolving an ability is not the same as triggering an ability. (Triggering the ability on Keeper of Secret Names results in two abilities being resolved: hers, and the ability on the chosen province).

The limit on how many time per [period] an ability can be used refers to the number of times it can be triggered, not resolved.

Therefore, Keeper of Secret Names can choose a province's action ability that has already been triggered, and choosing a province's action ability does not "use up" its limit.

You must still pay ability costs and meet play requirements to resolve a province’s action ability with Keeper of Secret Names. (eg. you need to discard cards to [Dishonorable Assault](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/dishonorable-assault) and you need 3+ participating Bushi to resolve [Riot in the Streets](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/riot-in-the-streets)).

While resolving Keeper of Secret Names’s ability, you are still at the province being attacked. Only the resolution of the targeted province's action ability “sees” you as being at that other province.
Keeper of Secret Names can choose a province controlled by your opponent. You are the player resolving the ability, so you choose any targets, and you resolve the effect/s.
Keeper of Secret Names cannot choose a facedown province.
All chosen cards must be in the same discard pile.

The next action opportunity ends when the reaction window to that action closes.

Therefore, all Interrupts and Reactions will also have their cost increased by 1.

All additional actions (eg. [Current of the Beryt](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/current-of-the-beryt)) are resolved within the first action opportunity, so will also have their cost increased by 1.

The next action opportunity ends when the reaction window to that action closes.

Therefore, all Interrupts and Reactions will also have their cost decreased by 1.

All additional actions (eg. [Current of the Beryt](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/current-of-the-beryt)) are resolved within the first action opportunity, so will also have their cost decreased by 1.
If Bayushi Shoju's opponent wins the Imperial Favor glory count, the Imperial Favor will be discarded.
A character ability is any ability (triggered, keyword, or constant) that is on a character.

You cannot play Invoke the Divine if you do not have at least one **Spell** card in your hand.

The **Spell** does not need to be in your hand when you play Invoke the Divine. You can play a card drawn via another **Spell** (eg. [Oracle of Stone](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/oracle-of-stone)).
Asahina Takamori can trigger his Reaction to his own entering play.

The conflict ends only after all participating characters move home bowed, so Doji Kuzunobu prevents players from triggering reactions to winning/losing the conflict, breaking a province, resolving ring effects, or claiming the contested ring.
You cannot trigger the Reaction on Benevolent Host when you put them into play by card effects. You can only do that when you play them. ('Play' and 'Put into play' are different things.)
You cannot trigger the Reaction on Agasha Taiko when you put them into play by card effects. You can only do that when you play them. ('Play' and 'Put into play' are different things.)

You cannot trigger the Reaction on Isawa Heiko when you put a  **Water** card into play by using card effects. You can only do that when you play them. ('Play' and 'Put into play' are different things.)
You cannot trigger the Reaction on Isawa Uona when you put an **Air** card into play by using card effects. You can only do that when you play them. ('Play' and 'Put into play' are different things.)
You cannot trigger the Reaction on Shinjo Gunsō when you put them into play by card effects. You can only do that when you play them. ('Play' and 'Put into play' are different things.)

**Disguised rulings**

- Disguised is an alternative method of playing a character. A Disguised character can be played normally, during the appropriate Action windows.

- If the non-unique character is participating in a conflict, the Disguised character may enter play in the conflict or at home.
If the non-unique character is at home, the Disguised character must enter play at home.

- Only the physical components (Fate, Status token, attachments) get moved to the Disguised character after it enters play. Lasting effects (eg. skill bonuses such as Banzai! or Supernatural Storm) are not transferred to the Disguised character.

- With the Disguised keyword, you can only play the character during the conflict phase. (You can play them normally during the timing windows appropriate for that card.)

- Reactions to a Disguised character being played wait for the entire process to complete.

- All attachments move to the Disguised character, and are then checked to see if they are legally attached.

- All attachments move simultaneously. Therefore, if one attachment relies on a trait provided by a second attachment (eg. Iaijutsu Master and Seal of the Crane), both attachments will remain attached.

If Matsu Tsuko wins a conflict at [Public Forum](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/public-forum), she can break the province twice. Once, during step 3.2.3 (Compare skill values and determine result), when she triggers her reaction, and a second time during step 3.2.5 (Break Province).

Shosuro Miyako's text supersedes the first dot point above.
She must replace a non-Unique character, using the Disguised keyword.

*This character can only be played by the disguised keyword.*

If Shosuro Miyako replaces a character with a [Cloud the Mind](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/cloud-the-mind) attached, Miyako cannot trigger her Reaction as the Cloud the Mind will be attached to Miyako before the opportunity to trigger it. 

*Reactions to a disguised character being played wait for the entire process to complete.*
Steward of Law prevents a dishonored status token from transferring to a Disguised character after it enters play via the Disguised keyword.

If your opponent elects to resolve the ability on Hand to Hand, they resolve all of the effects, including granting the option to their opponent (the player who originally played the card).

Therefore, a single copy of Hand to Hand can continue to alternate between two players, until one player elects not to resolve the ability, or there are no attachments left to choose.

If one of the three cards is a unique character, it cannot be discarded to add a fate to a copy of that character in play. The card is never in your province.

*A duplicate is a copy (**in a player's hand or provinces**) of a unique character...*
“*That ring effect*” and “*that ring*” refer to the ring effect that was cancelled (and its associated ring). Therefore, if no ring effect was cancelled, then the ability can do nothing more.
Once the normal ring effect for the conflict has been cancelled by Display of Power, you cannot play a second Display of Power as it would have nothing to cancel.
The cards in your hand are placed at the bottom of your conflict deck before you draw.

Skill modifiers on attachments are printed on the upper-left hand side of the card. Bayushi Gensato will not ignore card ability text that increases skill (eg. [Kakita Blade](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/kakita-blade)), even if that card text is on an attachment.
Iuchi Rimei can only target attachments on a character, as she cannot move it “*from the character it is on*” if it’s not on a character.

Characters played as attachments do not provide their printed skills as bonuses.

They lack the “+” or “–” symbol before the value, so do not add their skills to the attached character. And only characters contribute their skill to a conflict (Togashi Acolyte is considered to be an attachment rather than a character).
Monastery Protector applies it 1 fate cost to all of your opponent's events, even those that instruct another player to choose targets (e.g. [Court Games](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/court-games)).
Kuni Wasteland prevents **Action:**, **Reaction:**, and **Interrupt:** abilities from being triggered. Constant abilities are not affected.
Kuni Wasteland does not prevent Forced abilities (eg. [Isawa Ujina](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/isawa-ujina)) from triggering (as those abilities are triggered by the game).
Kuni Wasteland does not prevent abilities on out-of-play characters (eg. [Feral Ningyo](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/feral-ningyo)) from triggering.

Kuni Wasteland prevents all keywords on in-play characters during conflicts at the province, e.g. Covert and Pride.

Sincerity and Courtesy are resolved from out of play and are not prevented by Kuni Wasteland.

Kuni Wasteland does not prevent Disguised as the Disguised character is out-of-play.
The fate comes from the general token pool.

After you play an interrupt or reaction event that targets
a character with Dragon Tattoo attached, the tattoo can
be used to play that event again. The interrupt or reaction
event is played during the interrupt/reaction window that
the card was originally played in.

* When an interrupt or reaction is played in this way, it
is “queued” into the appropriate interrupt/reaction
window, but is not actually played until the reaction
window for playing the original event closes. Therefore,
cards like Watch Commander (Core, 133) will trigger
after the first instance of the event but before the
second instance of the event—this is different from when
Dragon Tattoo plays an action event, as an Action event
(such as Hurricane Punch (Elemental Cycle, 17)) is fully
played and resolved within the resolution of Dragon
Tattoo’s ability
Dragon Tattoo can be used to play an event that had its effects cancelled (eg. [Censure](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/censure)).

Adorned Barcha can be triggered to bow the chosen participating character, even if the attached character cannot move to the conflict (eg. [Pacifism](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/pacifism), or the attached character has a dash Mil skill). The bowing is not dependent on the movement.
Niten Pupil triggers its reaction after step D.4, which is before values are compared in step D.7.
If Elegant Tessen is played on a character with two other Restricted cards, its Reaction can only be triggered if it was not chosen to be discarded due to the Restricted keyword.
Shinjo Gunsō's Reaction is triggered, and resolved, before the province refills.
You cannot trigger the Reaction on Erudite Prestige when you put a card into play by card effects. You can only do that when you play a card. ('Play' and 'Put into play' are different things.)

The Reaction on Doji Hotaru can be triggered an Unlimited number of times per round, but only once per card played.

*A reaction with a specified limit that enables it to be triggered more than once per round may only be initiated once each time its specified triggering condition occurs.*

The Reaction on Erudite Prestige can be triggered an Unlimited number of times per round, but only once per card played.

*A reaction with a specified limit that enables it to be triggered more than once per round may only be initiated once each time its specified triggering condition occurs.*

The Reaction on Four Temples Advisor can be triggered an Unlimited number of times per round, but only once per time you gain fate from a ring. (Gaining multiple fate counts as one time).

*A reaction with a specified limit that enables it to be triggered more than once per round may only be initiated once each time its specified triggering condition occurs.*

The Reaction on Hall of Victories triggers an Unlimited number of times per round, but only once per conflict won.

A reaction with a specified limit that enables it to be triggered more than once per round may only be initiated once each time its specified triggering condition occurs.

The Reaction on Licensed Quarter can be triggered an Unlimited number of times per round, but only once per conflict win.

*A reaction with a specified limit that enables it to be triggered more than once per round may only be initiated once each time its specified triggering condition occurs.*
When played as an attachment during a conflict, Togashi Acolyte can trigger its reaction to itself entering play.
You cannot trigger the Reaction on Togashi Acolyte when you put a card into play by card effects. You can only do that when you play a card. ('Play' and 'Put into play' are different things.)

The Reaction on Shiro Kitsuki can be triggered an Unlimited number of times per round, but only once per declaration.

*A reaction with a specified limit that enables it to be triggered more than once per round may only be initiated once each time its specified triggering condition occurs.*

The Reaction on Watchtower of Valor can be triggered an Unlimited number of times per round, but only once per defensive conflict win.

*A reaction with a specified limit that enables it to be triggered more than once per round may only be initiated once each time its specified triggering condition occurs.*

Doji Kuzunobu does not prevent Forced Reactions, as they are triggered by the game, and not by a player.

If a ***Spell*** event played via Kyūden Isawa has its effects canceled, it is still removed from the game.

Cards are removed from the game faceup.

If a character with Softskin attached is targetted by an opponent's effect that would ready the character (eg. [Common Cause](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/common-cause)), the character's controller must pay the additional cost of discarding 3 cards.

referencing the current setting on the player’s honor dial.*

*If a card ability references a player’s honor bid, the ability is

You must declare the conflict type (and/or element/province) that allows you to attack with the maximum number of characters.
Test of Courage can be used to honor a Lion character that is already in the conflict, or cannot participate in the conflict.

Shosuro Miyako can be put into play, by cards such as [Ambush](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/ambush) and [From the Shadows](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/from-the-shadows). ('Play' and 'Put into play' are different things.)
You cannot trigger the Reaction on Shosuro Miyako when you put her into play by card effects. You can only do that when you play a card. ('Play' and 'Put into play' are different things.)

You cannot trigger the Reaction on Togashi Gaijutsu when you put a ***Tattoo*** attachment into play by card effects. You can only do that when you play a card. ('Play' and 'Put into play' are different things.)

The reactions to all aspects of the event (bow, send home, move province, reveal province, move in) are triggered after the event has fully resolved.

*When an event card is played, its costs are paid, its effects are resolved (or canceled), and it is placed in its owner's appropriate discard pile prior to opening the reaction window which follows the ability's resolution.*

If [All Out Assault](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/all-out-assault) is in effect, the interrupt on Seven Stings Keep will override this effect.
The controller of Seven Stings Keep will declare a number of attackers equal to the number chosen, instead of all of their characters that are able.

Moving status tokens between characters via card abilities is not considered to be honoring or dishonoring them – although they do become honored or dishonored. So, [Savvy Politician](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/savvy-politician)'s ability would not trigger.

If an honored status token is moved to a dishonored character, both tokens are discarded. 

An honored status token cannot be moved to an honored character, and a dishonored status token cannot be moved to a dishonored character.
Contemplative Wisdom will give the chosen character all printed abilities, regardless of type. This includes actions, constant abilities, interrupts, keywords, and reactions.
Contemplative Wisdom can give the chosen character the printed abilities if the attached character is blanked by [Cloud the Mind](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/cloud-the-mind).
The attacking player must select an option that can change the game state (cannot choose to bow if all their participating character are bowed, or discard if they have no cards in hand).

If you have only 1 or 2 cards in hand, you may choose to discard them all rather than bow your attacking characters.

*For all selections, an option that has the potential to change
the game state must be chosen, if able.*

*When a non-targeting effect attempts to engage a number
of entities that exceeds the number of entities that currently
exist in the specified game area, the effect engages as many
entities as possible.*

The Crashing Wave cannot be used to move the conflict to a province controlled by the attacking player. (An attacking player's province is not an "eligible" province for their own conflict declaration.)

Dragon Tattoo plays the event again, so will not be able to play an event with a Max restriction (eg. [Banzai!](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/banzai)). 

You may still trigger Dragon Tattoo solely to remove the event from the game without playing it.

Force of the River cannot be used during a Political conflict. 

*If a character has a dash (–) for a skill value, that character
cannot participate in, be played into, or be put into play in
conflicts of that type.*

Expert Interpreter instructs you to target a physical ring. If another ring gains the element of the chosen ring (via [Seeker of Knowledge](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/seeker-of-knowledge) or [Isawa Kaede](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/isawa-kaede)), the Interpreter's effect does not apply.

Acolyte of Koyane removes one instance of pride from the chosen character. If that character had multiple instances of pride, it is still considered to have pride.

Ichirō does not prevent a status token from being moved (eg. [Shameless Gossip](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/shameless-gossip)). Moving a status token to a character does not dis/honor the character.

A character chosen by Give No Ground will ignore all modifiers that reduce its skill, including those played before Give No Ground.
Take Up Command can ready a bowed character participating in the conflict, or can move a ready character to the conflict. (The ready and move are not dependent on one another).

If In Service to My Lord is played from the discard pile, and has its effects cancelled, it does not go to the bottom of its owner's conflict deck. If the cost can paid again, it can be played again from the discard pile.

If Educated Heimin is attached to a province that can refill multiple cards (eg. [City of the Rich Frog](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/city-of-the-rich-frog)), its effect (look at the top 2...) will be applied to each card, one at a time.

Henshin Mysteries does not prevent the Ring Effect from resolving.

A Dynasty character being played with Disguised is not considered to be played from hand.

*When playing a character using the disguised keyword, you may play that character during the conflict phase, following all timing rules which apply to playing characters from hand.*
A Season of War cannot discard Strongholds, but will discard any other cards in the Stronghold province.

If you lose control of the character that Serene Ise Zumi is attached to (eg. [Blackmail](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/blackmail)), Serene Ise Zumi will remain attached. (The “you control” part of that line of text only applies when playing the character.)

Characters leave play simultaneously. Therefore, honor from status tokens is gained and lost simultaneously.

Players calculate their cumulative gain/loss, and then adjust their honor total accordingly.

The additional character does not contribute skill to the conflict, and cannot be used to pay costs. 

The only affect that the additional character has is for those effects that look at the number of participating characters you control (eg. [Press of Battle](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/press-of-battle), [Challenge on the Fields](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/challenge-on-the-fields)).
Sacrificing a friendly character is the cost of Common Cause. By the time the ability's effects can be cancelled, costs have already been paid, and a friendly character has already been sacrificed.

A failed initiation attempt does not count towards Limits and Maximums. The opportunity to act is passed to the opponent.

The winner of the duel can only trigger **Action:** abilities, not Reactions or Interrupts.

Any Triggering Conditions and Targeting Requirements must still be met, and any costs must be paid.

eg. If the Action can only be triggered during a conflict at its province (eg. [Border Fortress](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/border-fortress)), or during a conflict of a particular element (eg. [Along the River of Gold](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/along-the-river-of-gold)).
