text:
Appeal to Sympathy can be used to cancel a Dynasty event.

The cancelled event will go to its owner's dynasty discard pile, rather than the top of its owner's conflict deck.

Mantra of Air can be played if your opponent declared an Air conflict. Switching the contested ring (eg. [Elemental Fury](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/elemental-fury)) does not change which ring was declared.

Mantra of Earth can be played if your opponent declared an Earth conflict. Switching the contested ring (eg. [Elemental Fury](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/elemental-fury)) does not change which ring was declared.

Mantra of Void can be played if your opponent declared a Void conflict. Switching the contested ring (eg. [Elemental Fury](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/elemental-fury)) does not change which ring was declared.
Elemental Fury does not change which ring was declared during conflict declaration.
Cunning Negotiator can initiate its duel, even if the attacked province does not have an action ability.
You cannot place additional fate on characters when you *put them into play* by card effects. You can only do that when you *play* characters from provinces or from hand.
The characters enter play at home.

The reaction on Retire to the Brotherhood is triggered and resolved in response to [step 3.2 Declare conflict](https://fiveringsdb.com/rules/reference#3-2-declare-conflict). 
Characters put into play by the attacking player cannot be declared as attackers, but the characters put into play can be declared as defenders in [step 3.2.1 Declare defenders](https://fiveringsdb.com/rules/reference#3-2-1-declare-defenders).

If a player reveals their entire deck and does not reveal a
number of characters equal to the number of characters
they discarded to this province’s effect, they do not reshuffle
their discard pile to keep revealing more cards. They only
put into play the characters revealed, even though this
results in fewer characters entering play than the number of
characters that were discarded.

If a player reveals multiple copies of a unique character
to this province’s effect, or reveals a unique character
already in play that they own or control, they do not put
the duplicate(s) into play. They do not reveal or put into
play any additional characters to make up for the unique
characters that could not enter play.

The effect of Study the Natural World adds the element(s) of the attacked province to the contested ring immediately and creates a
delayed effect that allows the attacking player to resolve
each of the contested ring’s effects if they win the conflict.
This delayed effect occurs during [step 3.2.3](https://fiveringsdb.com/rules/reference#3-2-3-compare-skill-values-and-determine-result) of conflict
resolution, at which point the attacking player may either
resolve all of the contested ring’s effects or none of them. It
does not replace framework step [3.2.6](https://fiveringsdb.com/rules/reference#3-2-6-resolve-ring-effects), when the attacking
player may also resolve one of the contested ring’s effects
as normal.
If you resolve the ring effect during the conflict (eg. [Kami Unleashed](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/kami-unleashed)) while Study the Natural World is active, you choose a single element.
The effect lasts until the end of the conflict.
The number of cards drawn is equal to the number of cards put on the bottom of your conflict deck, which may be les than X in some cases.

Mantra of Void can reduce the cost of characters played as attachments (eg. [Tattooed Wanderer](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/tattooed-wanderer), [Togashi Kazue](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/togashi-kazue)).

Ichirō prevents characters from having their status changed by anything that honors or dishonors a character. "Cannot be dis/honored" prevents the act of being dis/honored, which is different to "Cannot become dis/honored" which prevents entering the dis/honored status.

Niten cannot put into play characters that can be played as attachments (eg. [Tattooed Wanderer](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/tattooed-wanderer), [Togashi Kazue](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/togashi-kazue)).

source: RRG "In Play and Out of Play"
text: Master of Many Lifetimes cannot put a conflict character into a province. They would go to the conflict discard pile instead.

Characters played as attachments (eg. [Tattooed Wanderer](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/tattooed-wanderer), [Togashi Kazue](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/togashi-kazue)) will return to their owner's hand, as they are considered attachments while in play.

Multiple copies of Daughter of War attached to one character can each trigger (one at a time) when that character leaves play.

Spectral Visitation received official errata.

It now reads: “After this province is revealed – discard the top
4 cards of your dynasty deck. Then, choose a character in your
dynasty discard pile and put that character into play.”

*(Moved the phrase “Discard the top 4 cards of your dynasty
deck. Then, discard the choose a character in your dynasty
discard pile” from before the dash to after the dash.)*

A second ***Battlefield*** attachment can be attached to a province. The "Limit 1 ***Battlefield*** attachment per province" would then mean all other ***Battlefield*** attachments attached to that province are discarded.

A second ***Battlefield*** attachment can be attached to a province. The "Limit 1 ***Battlefield*** attachment per province" would then mean all other ***Battlefield*** attachments attached to that province are discarded.
When paying the additional cost for attacking a province other than Foothills Keep, fate cannot be spent to the ring selected to be the contested ring as the conflict is declared.
Brushfires can remove 1 fate from a character with only 1 fate. You may not remove only 1 fate from a character with 2 or more fate or choose a character with 0 fate.

The lasting effect of Kakita Dojo will expire before any 'at the end of the conflict' abilities or delayed effects (e.g.  [Forebearer's Echoes](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/forebearer-s-echoes)) resolve. 

A [Fushichō](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/fushicho) that has been put into play by Forebearer's Echoes and duelled by Kakita Dojo will be able to resolve its Interrupt ability when leaving play at the end of the conflict.

Any 'until the end of the conflict' lasting effects (e.g. [Kakita Dojo](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/kakita-dojo)) will expire before any 'at the end of the conflict' abilities or delayed effects (e.g.  [Forebearer's Echoes](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/forebearer-s-echoes)) resolve. 

A Fushichō that has been put into play by Forebearer's Echoes and duelled by Kakita Dojo will be able to resolve its Interrupt ability when leaving play at the end of the conflict.

Any 'until the end of the conflict' lasting effects (e.g. [Kakita Dojo](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/kakita-dojo)) will expire before the delayed effect of Forebearer's Echoes resolves. 

A [Fushichō](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/fushicho) that has been put into play by Forebearer's Echoes and duelled by Kakita Dojo will be able to resolve its Interrupt ability when leaving play at the end of the conflict.

When playing a character 'as if from hand' other effects see the character played only from hand, not from the province, until the character has been played and all reactions completed.

Reactions to being played from hand (e.g. [Shosuro Miyako](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/shosuro-miyako)) may be triggered. 
Reactions to being played from the province (e.g. [Shinjo Gunso](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/shinjo-gunso)) may not be triggered.

Doji Diplomat can only be triggered if each player is able to choose a facedown province they do not control. If one player's provinces are all faceup you are unable to choose sufficient targets to trigger the ability.

Doji Diplomat can only be triggered if each player is able to choose an opponent's character and has a fate in their fate pool to move to it.

Each character is a referential target and assessed individually when checking for a potential game state change.

Iron Crane Legion's printed military skill is 0. 

If an effect sets the military skill of Iron Crane Legion to a value (e.g. [Unmask](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/unmask), Iron Crane Legion's own ability cannot override the skill as it is a non-set modifier.

- Hantei XXXVIII interrupts step 1 of initiation.

- Hantei XXXVIII chooses all targets for the ability, including those in costs (e.g. [Favored Niece](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/favored-niece)) and effects, in abilities with multiple resolutions (e.g. [Banzai](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/banzai)) and duels.

- If the effect is cancelled or aborted due to interrupted costs, his ability has still been triggered. If Hantei XXXVIII leaves play after interrupting an ability and during its initiation, the Hantei XXXVIII controller still chooses all targets.

- Hantei XXXVIII can interrupt cards that choose from hidden zones (e.g. [Favored Niece](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/favored-niece)) but does not provide any knowledge of those hidden zones, effectively making the choice random.

- If a card with certain traits must be chosen from a hidden zone (e.g. [Miya Library](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/miya-library)), Hantei XXXVIII is unable to choose a matching card. Resolve the rest of the effects with no card chosen from the hidden zone.

- Hantei XXXVIII cannot interrupt [Ambush](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/ambush) if the opponent has no Scorpion characters in their provinces as there would be no legal targets.

- Hantei XXXVIII cannot interrupt [Seven Stings Keep](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/seven-stings-keep) to choose the number of characters.
Both players can trigger a province's interrupt or reaction ability in response to the same triggering condition. The first player will have the first opportunity to trigger the ability.

Additional conflicts are an upper limit, not a pool of options. If you declare the additional military conflict then Shori leaves play, an ability granting another military conflict (e.g. [Hisu Mori Toride](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/hisu-mori-toride-lion)) will effectively not allow you to declare that additional conflict.

If an event is discarded from your hand while paying costs to play that event its effects will not resolve, e.g. [Common Cause](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/common-cause) sacrifices Chancellor's Aide and leads to Common Cause being discarded from hand during costs.
The first player chooses their character first, then the second player. The opponent gives 1 honor at the same time as they choose a character.

If multiple honored/dishonored characters leave play simultaneously (e.g. [Retire to the Brotherhood](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/retire-to-the-brotherhood)), the 2 honor limit is applied before working out the net honor change from all characters.

For example, if 3 honored and 3 dishonored characters leave play simultaneously, the net change would be -1 honor.

The 3 card limit is per copy of Master Tactician, e.g. 2 Master Tacticians allow 6 cards to be played this way.

The first player chooses which Master Tactician's ability is being used to play the card for each card played.

If a character with a dash skill is declared as a defender and then the conflict is declared with that type, the dash skill character is sent home bowed.

The Scorpion player must declare a conflict type that allows them to declare a sufficient number of attackers.
Gensato only ignores the skill modifiers for purposes of duel resolution. The character's actual skill is not modified while the duel is resolving.

The ability can be triggered with fewer than 3 cards in hand, in which case it will discard all cards in hand and draw 3 cards.

The 3 cards are discarded at the same time as the 3 cards are drawn. You must decide which 3 cards are being discarded before drawing.

The card has received errata:

Should read: “Then, if that character is a Commander..."
*(Added “Then,")*
If your bid is 0 (e.g. [Contingency Plan](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/contingency-plan)), Iwasaki Pupil cannot reduce 0 and does not apply its minimum of 1 card.

If the character put into play by the ability has a reaction to a character being played (e.g. [Asahina Takamori](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/asahina-takamori)) that reaction may be triggered in response to Benevolent Host being played in the same window that Benevolent Host's ability was triggered in.

If you are unable to declare a military conflict (e.g. you lost [Kakita Yuri](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/kakita-yuri)'s duel) you cannot trigger Ivory Kingdoms Unicorn's ability. The conflict must be military if triggered and you are not able to declare a military conflict.

Multiple Compromised Secrets on a single character stack their additional costs.

The additional cost must be paid when the game triggers a forced ability on the attached character.

Chukan Nobue prevents an opponent's delayed effect from discarding cards, even if she wasn't in play at the time the originating ability was triggered.

For example, your opponent's [Under Siege](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/under-siege) will not discard your cards at the end of the conflict if you control Chukan Nobue.
Contested Countryside does not interact with forced abilities since they are triggered by the game and not the players.

If an opponent's card is in one of your provinces (e.g. [Akodo Zentaro](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/akodo-zentaro)) and turned facedown, it is moved to its owner's equivalent province after the cards are put in each province by Governor's Spy's controller.
Awakened Tsukumogami does not allow you to spend fate from rings to pay for *Maho* cards such as [Bonds of Blood](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/bonds-of-blood).

Fate will still be removed if a card leaves play during a conflict at this province as cards in the discard pile cannot have tokens on them, but card abilities (e.g. [Embrace the Void](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/embrace-the-void)) cannot replace this removal.

Superior Authority applies a lasting effect to the conflict, not the characters in play. Any characters without fate during conflict resolution are not counted, regardless of when they entered play or whether they lost fate during the conflict.

The character chosen by [Hiruma Yoshino](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/hiruma-yoshino) will not count their skill if Superior Authority has been played.

Grasp of Earth prevents opponent's characters from moving to the conflict even if they enter play after Grasp of Earth was triggered.

This reverses a previous ruling.

Guardians of Rokugan does not normally shuffle your deck after searching. The other top X cards should be placed back on top of the deck in the same order as they were originally drawn.

The only exception to this is if Guardians of Rokugan searches your entire deck (i.e. X is equal to or greater than your deck size), in which case you must shuffle after the search is completed.
The same player refers to the controller of the province, not the card in or attached to the province.
Any reactions to playing the character are held until after discarding the other cards.

All minimum must be observered regardless of the order of cost reduction effects. The highest minimum is the limiting factor when applying multiple minimums. 

Those Who Serve will not increase a 0 cost character to 1.

For example, after playing Those Who Serve:

[Meishodo Wielder](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/meishodo-wielder) as first player costs 1 fate.

[Eager Scout](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/eager-scout) costs 0 fate.

I trigger two [Yasuki Procurer](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/yasuki-procurer)'s then play [Shrewd Yasuki](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/shrewd-yasuki) for 1 fate.

Each opponent may choose to do nothing when Negotiation Table is triggered, leading to resolving the ability with no effect.

Bayushi Kachiko's 3 card limit is based on initiating the process of playing cards - step 3 of [Initiating Abilities / Playing Cards](https://fiveringsdb.com/rules/reference#initiating-abilities-playing-cards). This is before costs, targets, cancels and resolving the effects.

If the costs are prevented the card still counts as 1 of her 3 cards.
Rally will trigger on any revealed cards before choosing characters to put into play.

You cannot play [Noble Sacrifice](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/noble-sacrifice) during the conflict phase to sacrifice an honored Daidoji Netsu and discard another dishonored character. 

During step 1 of initiation Noble Sacrifice checks for eligible targets without taking into account consequences of the costs. At this time Daidoji Netsu is still in play and you are unable to choose a character that can be affected by Noble Sacrifice due to his ability.

The chosen ring is not out of play. It will not receive fate during the fate phase as it is not an unclaimed ring.

[Greater Understanding](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/greater-understanding) will remain attached to the chosen ring.

Abilities that refer to an unclaimed, claimed or contested ring cannot target the chosen ring. 

Abilities that refer to a ring without referencing claimed, unclaimed or contested are still able to interact with the chosen ring, e.g. [Master Alchemist](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/master-alchemist), [Master of Gisei Toshi](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/master-of-gisei-toshi).
If Desolation has blanked an Eminent province, that province can be turned facedown. It will remain facedown until revealed normally.
If Public Forum is turned facedown the faceup province leaves play and the honor token is removed.
Turning a province facedown makes the faceup province leave play. The dishonored status token from Return From Shadows is discarded when this happens.
Turning a province facedown makes the faceup province leave play. The dishonored status token from Meticulous Scout is discarded when this happens.

All of the effects before the then are simultaneous - bow and move home, move to another province, reveal it and move your characters in.

The opponent's characters are moved in after all of those effects have resolved.
You cannot trigger Endless Plains Skirmisher when it is already participating solely to make it switch sides in the conflict.
Seven Stings Keep triggers at the first step of declaring a conflict. See the timing chart [here](https://courtgamespod.com/topic/ruling-conflict-declaration-timings/) for full details.

Caravan Guard's fate must be paid before taking fate from the declared ring.

See the timing chart [here](https://courtgamespod.com/topic/ruling-conflict-declaration-timings/) for full details.

The 1 fate must be spent to an unclaimed ring before taking the fate from the declared ring.

See the timing chart [here](https://community.fantasyflightgames.com/topic/313033-ruling-conflict-declaration-timings/) for full details.
See the timing chart [here](https://courtgamespod.com/topic/ruling-conflict-declaration-timings/) for full details of the timing when playing Know the Terrain.
See the timing chart [here](https://courtgamespod.com/topic/ruling-conflict-declaration-timings/) for full details of the timing of playing The Crashing Wave.

The conflict is still considered to have been declared against the original province, not the chosen province. If the original province was faceup, it may trigger a reaction to the conflict being declared there as normal. 

The province you moved to may not trigger a reaction to declaring the conflict there but may still trigger a reaction to being revealed.
See the timing chart [here](https://community.fantasyflightgames.com/topic/313033-ruling-conflict-declaration-timings/) for full details of the timing of Tadakatsu's ability.
Iron Mountain Castle can let you play an attachment that costs 1 fate when you have 0 fate.
Iron Mountain Castle interrupts step 2 of initiation.
When playing a card with a fate cost of X (e.g. [Favorable Alliance](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/favorable-alliance)), Kunshu skips the step where X would be defined, making X equal 0.

source: RRG "Phase Sequence Timing Chart - Conflict Resolution"
text: The gained reaction triggers after step [3.2.3](https://fiveringsdb.com/rules/reference#3-2-3-compare-skill-values-and-determine-result) when the conflict is won. This is before step [3.2.7](https://fiveringsdb.com/rules/reference#3-2-7-claim-ring) when the contested ring is claimed. You will not get to resolve the effects of the contested ring while resolving the reaction.

Any excess *Restricted* attachments are removed one at a time until the game state is legal. If two Curse of Misfortune are attached to the same character you will not be able to discard both of them as the second Curse of Misfortune will lose *Restricted* when the first Curse of Misfortune is discarded.
Talented Performer does not force you to make decisions to ensure it can be chosen; rather that if it can be chosen, it must be.
Two Talented Performers in play does not mean that neither can be chosen by an event that targets a single character. The event can be played and must target one of the Talented Performers.

The character discards all attachments, fate and status tokens when it leaves play. You gain/lose an honor as normal if they were (dis)honored. Any lasting (e.g. [Banzai!](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/banzai)) or delayed (e.g. [Forebearer's Echoes](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/forebearer-s-echoes)) effects affecting the character expire as it leaves play.

The character enters play dishonored if it does not have the ***Shadow*** trait. There is no interaction with cards like [Young Rumormonger](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/young-rumormonger) or [Steward of Law](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/steward-of-law), as there is no transition from ordinary status to dishonored status.

Characters played from this province enter play dishonored. There is no interaction with cards like [Young Rumormonger](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/young-rumormonger) or [Steward of Law](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/steward-of-law), as there is no transition from ordinary status to dishonored status.

Characters are put into play under their owner's control unless otherwise specified. If you have taken control of an opponent's character (e.g. [Stoke Insurrection](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/stoke-insurrection)) and play Shadow Step on that character, it will enter play under it's owner's control, not your control.
The character enters play ready and at home.
Characters put into play from this province do not enter play dishonored.

An ability that chooses 'up to X' or 'any number of' targets can only choose 0 targets if it would still result in a game state change when resolved.

*For example, you cannot choose 0 characters when your opponent plays [Cavalry Reserves](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/cavalry-reserves) as that would lead to no change in game state.*

All chosen targets must still be legal targets for the triggered ability. Hantei XXXVIII only changes who is choosing the targets.

*For example, your opponent plays [Court Games](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/court-games) and selects to honor one of their characters. You must still choose one of their characters to be honored. Your own characters are not legal targets for the ability.*

Common Cause can choose a ready character an opponent controls as long as that character can be honored. 

*The character can be affected by some of the effects so you resolve as much as possible.*

If you trigger Master of Many Lifetimes while sacrificing a character for a cost (e.g. [Common Cause](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/common-cause)), that cost is not considered to be paid and the effects will not resolve.

If more than 1 Under Siege is played in a conflict, each copy played will set aside the defender's current hand and draw 5 new cards. The first player orders the delayed effects at the end of the conflict, effectively choosing which set aside cards end up in the defender's hand after all are resolved.
Righteous Samurai cannot trigger due to step [D.5 Transfer honor](https://fiveringsdb.com/rules/reference#d-5-transfer-honor) of a duel as it is a framework effect, not a card effect.

The Receding Tide can be played on a character you own that your opponent has taken control of, e.g. a character put into play by [Stoke Insurrection](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/stoke-insurrection).

The first player chooses their opponent's character first.

*For any question as to who should perform an act or make a decision first, in the absence of any other direction by card or rules text, the first player does so first, followed by the player to the first player’s left and continuing in clockwise order.*
A character can be chosen for the duel even if they have no fate to lose.
Both chosen characters must be participating in the conflict.

If Daidoji Uji's text box is blanked after triggering the reaction (e.g. [Cloud the Mind](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/cloud-the-mind)) and he then leaves play, the remaining cards under him are still removed from the game. The delayed effect was created by the reaction and persists even though his text box is now blank.

Finger of Jade can be triggered when you have chosen the attached character as the target of an opponent's ability, e.g. [Defend Your Honor](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/defend-your-honor) or [Vice Proprietor](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/vice-proprietor).

Shiba Yōjimbō can be triggered when you have chosen your Shugenja as the target of an opponent's triggered ability, e.g. [Defend Your Honor](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/defend-your-honor) or [Vice Proprietor](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/vice-proprietor).

Mushin no Shin can only cancel an ability that uses the word "choose" in its text. It cannot cancel [Way of the Crab](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/way-of-the-crab), [Consumed by Five Fires](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/consumed-by-five-fires), [Mark of Shame](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/mark-of-shame) or [Hawk Tattoo](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/hawk-tattoo).

Mushin no Shin cancels ***all*** effects of an ability that targets the character, even if that ability has multiple targets (e.g. [Shameful Display](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/shameful-display), [Ide Tadaji](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/ide-tadaji])).

If the effects of an ability are canceled, the ability is still considered to have been used, and any costs have still been paid.

Mushin no Shin cancels the effects of an ability when they initiate (in [step 6](https://fiveringsdb.com/rules/reference#initiating-abilities-playing-cards)) only if the character has already been chosen as a target (in step 5; the ability's text must use the word "choose" before the dash (–) in the ability's text).

Some abilities choose targets when the effects resolve (in step 7; "choose" is after the dash, e.g. [Court Games](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/court-games), [Shosuro Miyako](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/shosuro-miyako)), at that point it is too late to cancel their initiation.

Mushin no Shin can be triggered when you have chosen the character as the target of an opponent's effect, e.g. [Defend Your Honor](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/defend-your-honor) or [Vice Proprietor](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/vice-proprietor).
Triggered abilities are **Action:**, **Reaction:** and **Interrupt:** abilities. Covert is a keyword ability and cannot be cancelled by Mushin no Shin.

Procedural Interference cannot target a stronghold province.

*An upcoming errata will update the card to specify non-stronghold province.*
The character's ability limits are reset as a result of leaving and entering play, meaning its abilities that have already been triggered may be triggered again.

Never Yield affects each in-play character you control at the time it is played. Characters that enter play later in the conflict (e.g. via [Cavalry Reserves](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/cavalry-reserves)) are not affected and can be bowed or sent home as normal.

You can't choose a character whose skill cannot be modified (e.g. during a conflict at [Festival of the Departed](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/festival-of-the-departed)) to force the opponent to give you 1 honor. Deceptive Offer can't be played if there are no legal targets.
You must choose a character that can be bowed. You cannot choose a bowed character to force your opponent to give you 1 honor.
In Harmony does not prevent you removing fate from the attached character to pay costs (e.g. [Tetsubo of Blood](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/tetsubo-of-blood)). Costs are not a card effect

All other cards interact as though each character in play has no fate on it during conflicts at this province, even if there is fate on the character. For example:
- *Dire* abilities are active.
- [Mirumoto Raitsugu](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/mirumoto-raitsugu)'s duel discards the loser.
- [The Skin of Fu-Leng](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/the-skin-of-fu-leng) affects all opponent's characters.
- Fate cannot be spent from characters to play ***Mahō*** cards such as [Tetsubo of Blood](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/tetsubo-of-blood).

You cannot remove the last fate from [Kaito Mai](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/kaito-mai) and dishonor her in order to discard 3 attachments. Costs are paid simultaneously without considering the consequences of doing so. Kaito Mai's 0 glory wouldn't lead to a game state change in the effects and so she can't be dishonored, even though she would gain glory after costs.

If Kaito Mai's glory has been increased by other means (e.g. [Isawa Mori Seidō](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/isawa-mori-seido)) and you spend her last fate, she gains her Dire effect before targets are chosen, increasing the value of X.

If Embrace the Void is triggered when paying for a ***Mahō*** card (e.g. [Tetsubo of Blood](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/tetsubo-of-blood)), the fate cost is still considered to be paid.

*A replacement effect is an effect (usually an interrupt) that replaces the resolution of a triggering condition with a different means of resolving the same triggering condition, but in such a manner that the triggering condition is still considered to occur for the purposes of paying non-sacrifice costs.*
A card can have multiple instances of the same keyword, but functions as if it has one instance of that keyword.

You decide to spend 1 fate at the start of step 7 of initiation, after the normal initiation cancel window (e.g. for [Voice of Honor](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/voice-of-honor)) has already passed. The bow and dishonour effects resolve simultaneously.

You may choose a character that is already bowed but you must spend 1 fate if you do.
The first player chooses their ring first, then the second player. The opponent gives 1 honor at the same time as they choose a ring.
The first player chooses their character first, then the second player. The opponent gives 1 honor at the same time as they choose a character.
The first player chooses their character first, then the second player. The opponent gives 1 honor at the same time as they choose a character.
The first player chooses their character first, then the second player. The opponent gives 1 honor at the same time as they choose a character.
The first player chooses a player first, then the second player. The opponent gives 1 honor at the same time as they choose a player.
The first player discards their card first, then the second player. The opponent gives 1 honor at the same time as they discard a card.
Ikoma Prodigy can be triggered after fate is moved to the character.

You cannot choose a character that is unable to bow (e.g. they are already bowed) to force the opponent to remove 1 fate.

You can choose a character with no fate to force it to bow.
Adorned Temple can be triggered after fate is moved to a character by a card effect.
Characters with a dash (-) skill will not be switched by Furtive Sympathizer.
Province strength cannot be reduced below zero. All modifiers are applied as normal, then the strength is treated as zero if it is now below zero.
The ordinary status is checked at the time the Adorned Temple reaction is triggered, even if it has changed since the original triggering condition.
Province strength cannot be reduced below zero. All modifiers are applied as normal, then the strength is treated as zero if it is now below zero.

The characters enter play dishonored. There is no interaction with cards like [Young Rumormonger](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/young-rumormonger) or [Steward of Law](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/steward-of-law), as there is no transition from ordinary status to dishonored status.

You are considered to control the character triggering the ability during the entire [initiation](https://fiveringsdb.com/rules/reference#initiating-abilities-playing-cards) process for all gameplay purposes. You make all decisions for the triggered ability, you may use the character to pay costs (bow.., sacrifice.., etc.) and it is your character for duels. You do not gain control of any peripheral entities (attachments, tokens, etc.) associated with the character.

Master of Many Lifetimes cannot be triggered when using the Disguised keyword to put the non-unique back into a province as Interrupts cannot be used to replace or prevent the discard of that character.
Wayfarer's Camp can be used when you only have a single character faceup in your provinces. You must play a second character if one is available and can be played.
The characters are put into the province faceup.
The effects of Season of War are resolved by both players simultaneously. If both players would simultaneously dishonor due to reshuffling their dynasty decks, the first player wins.
Hantei XXXVIII cannot interrupt the resolution of Mirror's Gaze to choose targets as Mirror's Gaze resolves the ability without triggering it.

Tengu Sensei reacts at the same time as other reactions to a conflict being declared, e.g. [Midnight Revels](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/midnight-revels).

See the timing chart [here](https://courtgamespod.com/topic/ruling-conflict-declaration-timings/) for full details.
Effects that add cards to hand without using the term 'draw' are not considered to be drawing cards, e.g. the delayed effect of [Under Siege](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/under-siege).
You cannot trigger Shadowed Village when a character with fate leaves play outside the fate phase, e.g. discarded by [Assassination](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/assassination).

Attachments that must be attached to a character you control (e.g. [Dragon Tattoo](https://fiveringsdb.com/card/dragon-tattoo)) will fall off while using Skin of Fu Leng to resolve their triggered abilities.

*Control is changed during resolution of the ability and the attachment is not legally attached during that process.*
You can use Skin of Fu Leng to trigger the ability of a unique character even if you already control a copy of that unique character.
